0.title: UK donates 13 armoured vehicles to evacuate civilians from Ukraine
0.article_body: UK is sending 13 armoured vehicles to help evacuate civilians from besieged areas of eastern Ukraine, the government said on Tuesday. The steel-plated vehicles, which are bulletproof and can resist explosive devices and anti-personnel mines, will also be used to transport Ukrainian officials to their temporary command posts, UK said. The donation comes in response to a request from Ukraine.

1.title: Did Fadnavis become 'Mr India' & demolish Babri's dome?: Shiv Sena
1.article_body: Shiv Sena on Tuesday asked if BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis demolished Babri Masjid after becoming "Mr India". Responding to Fadnavis' claims that he was present "to bring [Babri Masjid] down", Shiv Sena said, "Shouldn’t history record that Fadnavis broke through the rising sea of Hindus and climbed Babri’s dome and continued to strike with hammers? This is amazing."

2.title: Indian student enrolled in Pak university, father chargesheeted for terror activities
2.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Police has filed a chargesheet against three persons, including an Indian student enrolled in a Pakistani university and his father, for indulging in terror activities. The accused also allegedly passed information across the border about Army units. Officials said this was another example of Pakistan misusing higher studies as bait for recruitment in terror groups.

3.title: Looks like 'ax the itch': Musk on pic of US politician in 'Tax the Rich' Met Gala 2021 dress
3.article_body: Elon Musk on Tuesday took a dig at US politician Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez by tweeting, "Can only read one side. Looks like "ax the itch"?" on Met Gala 2021 picture. She wore an off-white dress with a 'Tax the Rich' message. A few days ago, Musk asked Alexandria to "stop hitting" on him over her "billionaire with an ego problem" tweet.

4.title: BJP working to take India forward as a great power: JP Nadda
4.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda on Tuesday said that the party was working under the leadership of PM Narendra Modi to take India forward as a great power. Speaking on the occasion of the inauguration of South Delhi district BJP office in Okhla, he added that over 200 of the 512 offices being built across the country had been completed.

5.title: Woman declared dead knocks on coffin to say she's alive during her funeral in Peru
5.article_body: A woman who was declared dead after a car crash in Peru knocked from inside her coffin during her funeral to tell people she was alive. "[She] opened her eyes and was sweating. I immediately went to my office and called the police," cemetery caretaker said. She was reportedly put on life-support by doctors, but she died few hours later.

6.title: Nicholas Pooran appointed West Indies white-ball captain
6.article_body: Wicketkeeper-batter Nicholas Pooran has been appointed the captain of West Indies' ODI and T20I teams. This comes after Kieron Pollard announced his retirement from international cricket in April. "To be named captain is indeed the highlight of my career...I want to drive the team forward to accomplish great things," Pooran said.

7.title: Was on medication during viral Faiz & Ghalib interview: Saif Ali Khan
7.article_body: Saif Ali Khan, speaking about his old interview on Faiz and Ghalib, has said, "I think I'm on medication (in the interview). Let's call it medication." Saif added he's proud of that interview. In the viral interview, Saif had said Faiz and Ghalib are his favourite poets but later added, "I'm talking rubbish...Is this the age to reach such things?"

8.title: Aimed to play for India when MSD hit winning 6 in WC 2011 final: CSK's Mukesh
8.article_body: Revealing what made him decide that he'd like to play for India someday, CSK pacer Mukesh Choudhary said it was when MS Dhoni hit the match-winning six in 2011 World Cup final. "I used to play cricket but...began taking the game more seriously after that historic moment," he added. Mukesh has taken 11 wickets in IPL 2022 so far.

9.title: Small, big parties should unite to oust BJP from Centre: AK Antony
9.article_body: Congress leader AK Antony on Tuesday said that all small and big parties need to unite and come on a common platform in order to remove the BJP from the Centre. He said that Congress should take the lead in this, however, 'some' people believe it can be done without them. "What can be said to such people," he added.

10.title: Urge people to contribute to relief material for Sri Lanka: TN CM
10.article_body: Amid the economic crisis in Sri Lanka, Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin urged people to contribute to the humanitarian relief material to be sent to Sri Lanka. MK Stalin thanked External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar for accepting Tamil Nadu's request on supplementing India's humanitarian aid to the country. Earlier, Tamil Nadu sought permission to supply essentials to Sri Lanka.

11.title: Chicken song is the most political song in 'Bajrangi...': Kabir Khan
11.article_body: Kabir Khan has said that the song 'Chicken Kuk-Doo-Koo' is the most political song of his film 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan' because it came in the face of the beef ban. He added 'Chaudhary Dhaba' in the song is a metaphor for India. "Half dhaba is non-veg, half is veg. You decide what you want...[we] can sit together and eat," he said.

12.title: Body scrub is 1 thing that helped my anxiety: Aamir Khan's daughter
12.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan's daughter Ira Khan wrote on Instagram that body scrub is the one thing that helped her anxiety. She added that "it made for a heightened tactile...experience". Ira further wrote that she is "caught up" in her own head "too much" and "increasing the number of tactile experiences" in her daily life "may be a good idea".

13.title: Facebook to shut down podcast service after a year on June 3
13.article_body: Facebook is shutting down its podcast service and will remove them altogether from its platform on June 3, Bloomberg reported citing a company note. Users won't be allowed to add podcasts starting this week while the Live Audio Rooms will reportedly be integrated into Facebook Live. Facebook had launched these in June 2021 in competition to Clubhouse live audio app.

14.title: Video shows PM Modi playing dhol in Denmark's Copenhagen
14.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi played dhol as he reached the venue to meet the Indian community on his visit to Denmark's Copenhagen on Tuesday. A video shows Indians dressed in traditional attire dancing near the venue. On Monday, PM Modi played the drums when he arrived at the Potsdamer Platz in Germany's Berlin to address the Indian diaspora.

15.title: Inclusiveness, cultural diversity strength of Indian community: PM in Denmark
15.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, while addressing Indian nationals in Copenhagen during his visit to Denmark on Tuesday, said that "inclusiveness and cultural diversity" is the strength of the Indian community. "Whatever the language, our culture is Indian. We believe in 'Vasudhaiva Kutumbakam' – one world," he added. "We stand together for the defence of the nation," the PM further said.

16.title: We should use cinema as soft power, win hearts of future generations: Shekhar
16.article_body: Filmmaker Shekhar Kapur stated that if India has to use cinema as a soft power, we have to win the minds and hearts of future generations around the world. He further said that our stories should be told through popular media like gaming using the latest technology. "I'd like to see games featuring Indian characters in Indian costumes," Shekhar added.

17.title: Rumours over leadership change hypothetical: K'taka BJP in-charge
17.article_body: BJP national General Secretary in-charge of Karnataka Arun Singh called rumours of possible leadership changes in Karnataka hypothetical. He said CM Basavaraj Bommai is a common man and people liked him. He added that cabinet expansion or reshuffle was the prerogative of the CM. BJP's Karnataka President Nalin Kumar Kateel also said there was no confusion regarding party leadership.

18.title: 3,000 people flee armed clashes in northern Iraq
18.article_body: At least 3,000 people fled Iraq's Sinjar and its surrounding areas after clashes broke out between the Iraqi army and local fighters linked to a Kurdish separatist group. They headed farther north towards the semi-autonomous Kurdish region to seek asylum. An Iraqi soldier was killed and two others were injured in the clashes, an army officer and an MP said.

19.title: UP CM Yogi Adityanath meets mother after several years in native village, shares pic
19.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, who is currently in his native village Panchur in Pauri Garhwal district of Uttarakhand, met his mother after several years and shared a photo on Twitter. Captioned 'Ma', the photo shows him touching her feet. He also paid a visit to the teachers of his school.

20.title: 1,50,000 Ukrainians using Starlink internet service daily: Govt
20.article_body: About 1,50,000 people in Ukraine are using SpaceX's Starlink internet service each day, Ukraine Digital Minister Mykhailo Fedorov tweeted. He added, "This is crucial support for...restoring the destroyed territories. Ukraine will stay connected no matter what." This comes after SpaceX CEO Elon Musk activated Starlink service in Ukraine in February following Fedorov's request amid war with Russia.

21.title: Russian forces launch attack on besieged Mariupol steel plant
21.article_body: Russian forces on Tuesday launched an attack on a steel plant in Mariupol, Ukrainian forces defending it said. "We'll do everything that's possible to repel the assault, but we're calling for urgent measures to evacuate the civilians that remain inside the plant," a Ukrainian military official said. About 200 civilians are estimated to be trapped in the plant.

22.title: Jain University tops Khelo India University Games, Amit Shah presents trophy
22.article_body: Jain University has topped the Khelo India University Games 2021 in Bengaluru, ending with 20 gold, seven silver and five bronze medals. Chief guest at closing ceremony Union Home Minister Amit Shah presented the trophy and congratulated all the universities and athletes who participated in the event. Lovely Professional University and Panjab University stood second and third respectively.

23.title: Concerned for son Ibrahim's future, I'm full of nervous prayer: Saif
23.article_body: Actor Saif Ali Khan said he's concerned for his son Ibrahim Ali Khan's future. "He has done well in school and like any parent, I'm full of nervous prayer that his future goes well," he added. Ibrahim is currently assisting filmmaker Karan Johar in 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani'. "I am happy he is working hard," Saif stated.

24.title: There should be mutual respect: Nitish Kumar on loudspeaker issue
24.article_body: Commenting on the loudspeaker issue, Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar said that there should be mutual respect for each other in the country irrespective of their religion. After attending a prayer on the occasion of Eid, Nitish Kumar said, "There are people who have a certain belief and they act accordingly and this should be respected."

25.title: UP CM Yogi unveils statue of his spiritual guru in Uttarakhand
25.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath unveiled the statue of his spiritual guru Brahmalin Mahant Avaidyanath at the Guru Gorakhnath Mahavidyalaya premises in Uttarkhand's Yamkeshwar on Tuesday. Addressing a function, CM Yogi said he had attended a school in Chamkotkhal near Yamkeshwar from class 1 to 9 and that he was grateful to get the opportunity to honour his school teachers.

26.title: West should use its influence to stop Ukraine war crimes: Putin to Macron
26.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin told his French counterpart Emmanuel Macron in a telephonic conversation on Tuesday that the West should use its influence to halt atrocities in Ukraine. Putin said that West could stop supplying arms to Ukraine and help stop "war crimes (and) massive shelling of towns...in Donbas". Russia has denied war crimes by its forces in the country.

27.title: The constant bullying, trolling makes me go crazy: Urfi Javed
27.article_body: 'Bigg Boss OTT' fame Urfi Javed has reacted to "the constant bullying [and] trolling" she faces saying that it makes her go crazy sometimes. She wrote in a now-deleted Instagram story that "the hate...abuses...trolls...rape threats...death threats" get her at times. "Usually I'm ok but today is a very rare day where I feel like giving up," Urfi wrote.

28.title: Shah Rukh Khan greets fans from Mannat on Eid after 2 yrs, shares pics
28.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan greeted his fans from his residence Mannat's balcony after a gap of two years on the occasion of Eid. Taking to Twitter, he shared pictures of him greeting his fans and wrote, "How lovely to meet you all on Eid...Eid Mubarak!!" He did not greet fans for the past two years due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

29.title: Always take your people with you: Anil Agarwal on secret to success
29.article_body: Vedanta's billionaire Chairman Anil Agarwal on Monday shared what he believes is the secret to his success. "I often get asked, 'How did you do it?' The answer is very simple. No matter how far you get in life, you must always take your people with you," Agarwal wrote. "You must empower your people to deliver their best," he added.

30.title: Video shows 18-yr-old Indian-origin UK man crashing stolen Range Rover into Mercedes van
30.article_body: UK's Metropolitan Police has released a video showing the moment an 18-year-old Indian-origin man crashed a stolen Range Rover car into a Mercedes van last year. "This is the moment a dangerous driver drove the wrong way through the Blackwall Tunnel. 18-year-old Johal Rathour has been jailed," it tweeted. He has been jailed for four years.

31.title: Inspire at least 5 friends to visit India: PM to Indian diaspora in Denmark
31.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday interacted with the Indian community in Copenhagen, Denmark and asked them to inspire others to visit India. "You should inspire at least five of your friends to visit India...and people will say 'Chalo India'," he said. PM Modi further said, "This is the work you all 'Rashtradoot' have to do."

32.title: 10 killed, 11 injured in jeep-auto collision in UP's Kasganj
32.article_body: Ten people, including two children and seven women, were killed after their autorickshaw collided head-on with a speeding jeep in UP's Kasganj district on Tuesday. The jeep driver had allegedly fallen asleep while driving, leading to the crash, according to the investigation by police. 11 people travelling in the jeep were also injured and were admitted to hospital, police said.

33.title: Cambodia's PM calls for access to Myanmar's ousted leader Suu Kyi
33.article_body: Cambodia's PM Hun Sen has urged Myanmar's junta chief Min Aung Hlaing to allow a special envoy from ASEAN access to ousted leader Aung San Suu Kyi. Sen, the current Chairman of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN), made the request during a video call on Monday. Min Aung Hlaing had led a coup against Suu Kyi last year.

34.title: Rocket Lab catches rocket booster returning from space using a helicopter
34.article_body: US-based space company Rocket Lab captured its rocket booster returning from space using a helicopter for a test. "The mid-air capture is a major milestone in our pursuit to make a reusable rocket to increase launch frequency," the company said. Rocket Lab used a combination of ropes, parachutes, a heat shield and a helicopter with two pilots for the test.

35.title: Loudspeaker row created to divert focus from Centre's failures: Ex-MP CM
35.article_body: Ex-MP CM Digvijaya Singh said on Tuesday that the ongoing loudspeaker controversy has been created to deflect focus from Centre's failures. "All these are useless talks...People’s attention is being diverted from issues like...inflation and unemployment," he added. MNS leader Raj Thackeray had said that Hanuman Chalisa will be played outside mosques if loudspeakers there aren't removed by May 3.

36.title: Childless UP woman hires gang for ₹20,000 to abduct 2-yr-old boy, arrested
36.article_body: A woman, desperate for a child after losing her toddler due to illness, hired a gang for ₹20,000 to abduct a two-year-old boy so she could raise him as her son in Uttar Pradesh. Four, including two women and a teenager, have been arrested. The boy was abducted from a railway station's platform, where he was sleeping near his father.

37.title: 'Sacred Games' raised the bar for Indian content: Shweta Tripathi
37.article_body: Actress Shweta Tripathi has said Nawazuddin Siddiqui-starrer 'Sacred Games' raised the bar for Indian content. "Before that, there was a level of content being churned out," she stated. "The show made way for everyone to make the best of content," she added. Shweta said she's currently reading the script of 'Mirzapur 3' and added it is better than previous seasons.

38.title: Porn clip plays on projector during Union Minister's event in Assam; probe launched
38.article_body: An investigation has been launched after a pornographic clip was allegedly played on a projector during a recent event attended by Union Minister Rameswar Teli and Assam Minister Sanjoy Kishan. The incident took place during the pilot rollout of methanol-blended M-15 petrol in Assam's Tinsukia by Indian Oil. Police have reportedly detained a projector operator in connection with the incident.

39.title: Pilots' federation reject claim of Runway 34 being based on true events
39.article_body: Federation of Indian Pilots Secretary Captain CS Randhawa stated airline pilots are "unrealistically portrayed" in Ajay Devgn's 'Runway 34', adding it may create apprehensions in the minds of fliers. The statement said the film's story shouldn't be perceived as a true depiction of pilots' professionalism. It added industry has a zero-tolerance policy towards deviant behaviour and substance abuse.

40.title: 'Get out!' TV anchor tells Telugu actor Vishwak Sen during debate over 'suicide prank'
40.article_body: A video shows a news anchor shouting at Telugu actor Vishwak Sen during a debate on his 'suicide prank' video. Sen is heard saying, "You better mind your tongue and not call me...depressed person" after which the anchor says, "You can get out of my studio." Vishwak took part in the prank video as part of promotions for his film.

41.title: 'RRR' is truly a treat for all senses, world class cinema: Anil Kapoor
41.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor on Monday took to Twitter to appreciate filmmaker SS Rajamouli's 'RRR' calling it "one of the most entertaining and phenomenal films of recent times." He further wrote, "Truly a treat for all senses! World class cinema!" Anil went to watch the film with veteran actor Anupam Kher at a theatre and said it felt like a date.

42.title: Sri Lankan govt to provide cash to low income families amid crisis
42.article_body: Low income Sri Lankan families "severely affected" by the country's current economic crisis will receive a cash allowance from the government. Cash allowances ranging from LKR 3,000 to LKR 7,500 will be provided to such families. The move is expected to benefit about 33 lakh families from May to July, according to Trade Minister Shehan Semasinghe.

43.title: Salman Khan greets fans from balcony on Eid after 3 yrs, shares pics
43.article_body: Actor Salman Khan on Tuesday greeted and waved at his fans from the balcony of his house in Bandra's Galaxy Apartments after a gap of three years due to the pandemic. He also shared pictures of greeting the crowd on social media. Salman's Eid bash will reportedly be hosted at his sister Arpita Khan and her husband Aayush Sharma's residence.

44.title: Char Dham yatra begins as Gangotri-Yamunotri portals opens for devotees
44.article_body: The Char Dham yatra began on Tuesday as the portals of Gangotri and Yamunotri temples in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi were opened for devotees. CM Pushkar Singh Dhami, along with his wife, visited Gangotri to offer prayers and witness the ceremonious opening of the temple gates. The daily limit on the number of pilgrims for Gangotri is 7,000 and 4,000 for Yamunotri.

45.title: He's like a trigger, bang: Ferdinand picks Diaz as his PL signing of season
45.article_body: Picking Liverpool winger Luis Fernando Diaz as his Premier League signing of the season, ex-Manchester United defender Rio Ferdinand said, "He's like a trigger, bang, go, go and get it back." He added, "You watch him play, on the ball he's brilliant...but his reaction when they lose the ball is unreal." The 25-year-old was signed by Liverpool in January.

46.title: Manika jumps 10 spots for career-best world no. 38, Sathiyan becomes no. 34
46.article_body: Paddler Manika Batra has jumped 10 spots to attain a career-high ranking of 38 in women's singles, while Sathiyan Gnanasekaran was the best placed Indian at 34 in men's side in latest International Table Tennis Federation (ITTF) rankings. Meanwhile, Sharath Kamal gained one place to be number 37. In men's doubles, Sathiyan and Harmeet Desai are ranked 29th.

47.title: Indian community chants 'Modi, Modi' as PM meets them in Denmark, video surfaces
47.article_body: A video shared by the Prime Minister's Office shows PM Narendra Modi and Danish PM Mette Frederiksen meeting the Indian community after a meeting with business leaders in Copenhagen, Denmark. In the video, the people can be seen carrying the Indian national flag and chanting 'Modi, Modi'. PM Modi and his Danish counterpart greeted the crowd.

48.title: Cumin prices set to rise 30-35% to touch five-year high: Report
48.article_body: An estimated 35% decline in production in crop season 2021-22 that started in November is set to drive up cumin prices to a five-year high, ratings agency Crisil reported. As per its report, cumin prices are likely to rise up to 30-35% to reach ₹165-170 per kg. It further stated that cumin acreage this season fell by 21% year-on-year.

49.title: SII's Covovax now available for children in India: Poonawalla
49.article_body: SII's COVID-19 vaccine Covovax is now available for children, CEO Adar Poonawalla said on Tuesday. A dose of Covovax for children aged 12-17 will cost ₹900, in addition to hospital service charge of ₹150, PTI reported. "This is the only vaccine manufactured in India that is also sold in Europe and has an efficacy of over 90%," Poonawalla added.

50.title: Aurobindo Pharma gets USFDA nod for generic cancer treatment drug
50.article_body: Hyderabad-based Aurobindo Pharma said its wholly-owned arm Eugia Pharma Specialties Ltd has received approval from the US Food and Drug Administration (USFDA) for its generic Bortezomib drug. It is used to treat adult patients with multiple myeloma and mantle cell lymphoma. The approved product has a market size of $1.172 billion for the year ended March 2022, the company said.

51.title: National-level hockey player's hut demolished in anti-encroachment drive in MP
51.article_body: A hut belonging to 18-year-old national-level hockey player Sagu Dawar and her family was demolished during an anti-encroachment drive conducted by police and Mandsaur administration in Madhya Pradesh. Dawar claimed she and her family had asked the administration for two-three days' time to vacate the land, but police went ahead with the demolition before they could leave with their belongings.

52.title: China's Zhengzhou imposes COVID-related movement curbs from May 4-10
52.article_body: China's Zhengzhou city on Tuesday announced that it would impose coronavirus-related curbs on movements from May 4 to 10. Schools in the main city district will go online, while employees of government organisations and companies must work from home during that period, an official statement said. The new measures would be subject to adjustment after May 10, it added.

53.title: Heard hires new crisis management firm amid defamation trial
53.article_body: Amber Heard has hired a new crisis management firm amid the ongoing defamation suit filed against her by ex-husband Johnny Depp. New York Post stated her new team earlier worked against Depp in a case by his former business managers. They had alleged that Depp needed to hire a shrink for his "compulsive spending" habit of $2 million per month.

54.title: President Kovind arrives in Assam for 4-day Northeast tour
54.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind arrived in Assam's Guwahati on Tuesday for a four-day Northeast tour. He was received at the Lokpriya Gopinath Bordoloi International Airport by CM Himanta Biswa Sarma and Governor Jagdish Mukhi. He'll be addressing the 61st annual conference of Bodo Sahitya Sabha in Tamulpur on Wednesday and will also attend North East Festival's valedictory function in Guwahati.

55.title: Will protest in Jodhpur if no action taken on clashes: Union Minister
55.article_body: Reacting to recent Jodhpur violence, Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat on Tuesday said that the law and order situation in Rajasthan is in disarray. Shekhawat added that he will hold a "massive protest" at city's Jalori Gate if no action is taken on the incident. Clashes broke out between two communities in the city after Eid prayers on Monday night.

56.title: Congress shares pic of BJP's Javadekar popping champagne at party
56.article_body: Congress leader Srinivas BV has shared a picture of Rajya Sabha MP Prakash Javadekar popping a champagne bottle at a party. "Pehchan kaun?" Srinivas BV captioned the picture. This comes after a video went viral showing Congress leader Rahul Gandhi at a nightclub in Kathmandu. Congress said Rahul went to Nepal to attend the wedding of a friend.

57.title: Taught him to walk, he trampled us: Shivpal amid reports of rift with Akhilesh
57.article_body: Pragatisheel Samajwadi Party-Lohia chief Shivpal Yadav, in an apparent reference to his nephew and Samajwadi Party President Akhilesh Yadav, on Tuesday said he compromised on self-respect to "satisfy" him, but was still hurt. Taking to Twitter, he added, "We taught him how to walk and he went on trampling us." His remarks came amid reports of a rift with Akhilesh.

58.title: Scheme to provide meals to BEST staffers in Mumbai launched
58.article_body: Maharashtra Minister Aditya Thackeray launched a scheme along with Akshaya Chaitanya, an NGO, to provide meals to Brihanmumbai Electric Supply & Transport Undertaking (BEST) staffers in Mumbai. He added that they also intend to provide free meals to around 6,000 to 7,000 people including students of municipal schools and families in government hospitals.

59.title: Want to meet Putin in Moscow, discuss Ukraine's invasion: Pope
59.article_body: Pope Francis said on Tuesday that he'd requested to meet Russian President Vladimir Putin in Moscow to discuss Ukraine's invasion but hadn't received a response from Russia. Pope added that while he's still keen on meeting Putin, the latter perhaps "does not want to have this meeting". Notably, Pope has denounced ongoing war and appealed for peace on multiple occasions.

60.title: 19 crore doses of COVID vaccines available with states, UTs: Govt
60.article_body: The Union Health Ministry on Tuesday said that states and Union Territories (UTs) have more than 19.01 crore balance and unutilised doses of COVID-19 vaccines. Separately, over 193.53 crore doses of vaccines have been provided to states and UTs so far, it added. The government is committed to accelerating the pace of COVID-19 vaccination throughout the country, it further said.

61.title: 2 booked under NSA by police after brawl in pub in MP's Indore
61.article_body: Police in Madhya Pradesh's Indore on Tuesday booked two persons under the National Security Act (NSA) in connection with a brawl that broke out in Four More Shots pub recently. It is believed one of the accused is the manager of the pub. At least 12 people have been arrested so far in connection with the incident.

62.title: Porters at MP's Bhopal railway station to get AC restrooms
62.article_body: Air-conditioned restrooms for porters are being planned at MP's Bhopal railway station. Minister of Medical Education Vishvas Sarang said that the retiring rooms will be constructed on the side of platform number one. Sarang also informed that a two-lane railway overbridge will be built from Chola Mandir to platform number one of the main railway station to facilitate people's movement.

63.title: 2 tribal men accused of cow slaughter beaten to death in MP, another injured
63.article_body: Two tribal men were beaten to death by a group of 15-20 people over suspicion of cow slaughter in Madhya Pradesh's Seoni district. Another person was left injured by the attackers in the incident. "We have taken two-three suspects into custody. Some 12 kilograms of meat have been found at the victims' house," Seoni Additional Superintendent of Police said.

64.title: Neither I can confirm nor deny: Ashneer on alleged old audio of abusing bank employee
64.article_body: BharatPe's ex-MD Ashneer Grover at a recent event said, "Neither I can confirm nor deny it," when he was asked about the old audio clip of him allegedly verbally abusing a Kotak employee. "This is a bitter question," Grover said on the question about the audio. Earlier, reports said Grover abused the employee over missing share allocation in Nykaa's IPO.

65.title: PM Modi mentions the term 'FOMO' while talking about those not investing in India
65.article_body: While addressing a business forum in Denmark's Copenhagen on Tuesday, PM Narendra Modi said that the term 'FOMO' (fear of missing out) is gaining traction on social media these days. "Looking at India's reforms and investment opportunities, I can say that those who don't invest in our nation will certainly miss out," he added.

66.title: GST on online gaming may be raised from 18% to 28%: Reports
66.article_body: The Group of Ministers has recommended casinos, racecourses and online gaming shall be taxed under the 28% GST slab, reports said on Tuesday. Currently, online gaming is taxed at 18% of the platform fee, which works out to 5-20% of the contest entry amount. Chance gaming like racing, betting and lotteries are taxed at 28% of the contest entry amount.

67.title: BCCI announce schedule for IPL 2022 playoffs
67.article_body: IPL 2022 playoffs and final will be played from May 24 to May 29 in Kolkata and Ahmedabad, the BCCI have announced. Qualifier 1 will be held at Eden Gardens in Kolkata on May 24, followed by Eliminator on May 25. Ahmedabad's Narendra Modi Stadium will host Qualifier 2 and IPL 2022 final on May 27 and May 29, respectively.

68.title: NASA shares video that simulates a black hole, people compare it with 'Interstellar'
68.article_body: NASA's Instagram page shared a visualisation simulating appearance of a black hole as seen on its edge, where inbound matter has collected into a thin, hot structure called an accretion disk. Referring to the 2014 film 'Interstellar', an Instagram user commented, "Reminds me of the black hole in Interstellar." "You can tell Interstellar production worked with scientists," another person commented.

69.title: Parents don't pay for my s**t, it's sad reality: Harsh Varrdhan Kapoor
69.article_body: Actor Harsh Varrdhan Kapoor has said, "My parents have no interest in paying for my s**t...I'd have had ten times more than what I have but I buy my...stuff." "It's the sad reality of my life," he added. Harsh said he is looking to buy a pre-owned Lamborghini for ₹1 crore instead of buying a new model for ₹3 crore.

70.title: Why is removing loudspeakers a problem in Delhi: BJP's Adesh Gupta
70.article_body: Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta condemned the Aam Aadmi Party-led government in Delhi, questioning why removing loudspeakers from religious institutes in Delhi was a problem when there are no loudspeakers in mosques of Muslim countries either. The BJP Delhi unit wrote a letter to Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal saying noise pollution level had reached its extreme in Delhi.

71.title: Knock against Cottrell in IPL 2020 gave Tewatia confidence: Gavaskar
71.article_body: Talking about batter Rahul Tewatia, who has been helping GT finish off run-chases on a regular basis in ongoing IPL, Sunil Gavaskar said the assault on Sheldon Cottrell in IPL 2020 gave him confidence that he belongs to this level. Tewatia hit five sixes in 18th over bowled by Cottrell to help his then team RR win by four wickets.

72.title: Lion mauls 5-year-old girl to death in Gujarat's Amreli
72.article_body: Forest officials said that a five-year-old girl was mauled to death by a lion in Gujarat's Amreli, after which the lion was caught and taken to an animal care centre. The victim was the daughter of a farm labourer from Rajasthan. She was playing in the village when the lion attacked her and dragged her, the officials added.

73.title: BJP sent demolition notice to 4 Delhi temples to extort money: Atishi
73.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party's Atishi on Tuesday alleged that the BJP-led Central government posted demolition notices on the walls of four temples in Delhi in order to extort money. She said that the BJP government had issued the order to demolish the Neelkanth Mahadev temple in Sriniwaspuri and a similar order has now been issued against four temples of Sarojini Nagar.

74.title: Stash of arms, ammunition including AK-56 recovered from Arunachal
74.article_body: A huge cache of arms, ammunition and explosives were recovered by the Indian army from Arunachal Pradesh's Changlang district on Tuesday. Police said that 14 Rajput Regiment recovered the arms and ammunition from the forest area of Phinbiro-I, suspected to be hidden by a proscribed outfit. One AK-56 rifle, two SBML guns were among the recovered ammunition.

75.title: Thieves steal jewellery, cash worth ₹1.5 lakh from parked car in MP
75.article_body: A bag containing jewellery and cash worth about ₹1.5 lakh was stolen from a car in MP's Ujjain on Monday. The owner had parked his car outside the premises of a building where he had gone to attend a wedding ceremony. A family member found the window broken and valuables missing after she returned to the car around 3 pm.

76.title: Jared Leto & Gucci's Alessandro Michele twin at Met Gala 2022
76.article_body: Actor Jared Leto twinned with Gucci designer Alessandro Michele at the Met Gala 2022. The duo donned the same tuxedos, clutches, hair clips and sunglasses while posing for cameras together at the event. Leto and Michele also wore the same red bow ties, black gloves and shoes. Last year, Leto carried a replica of his head at the Met Gala.

77.title: Table-toppers GT to bat first against PBKS, both teams unchanged
77.article_body: Table-toppers Gujarat Titans (GT) captain Hardik Pandya won the toss and elected to bat first against Punjab Kings (PBKS) in their IPL 2022 clash on Tuesday. Both the teams are playing with unchanged playing XIs. GT have won five matches in a row, while PBKS are currently eighth on the points table with four wins from nine matches.

78.title: My free speech banned over Kashmir Files, I'm victim of hate campaign: Vivek
78.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri has shared a video on Twitter claiming that he is a "victim of a hate campaign" and his "free speech was banned" over 'The Kashmir Files'. He said that a group of foreign journalists had invited him to address a press conference but it was cancelled after some members of "powerful media" took "strong objection" to it.

79.title: Won't celebrate Eid this year, my mom is in ICU: Zareen Khan
79.article_body: Actress Zareen Khan has stated that she will not celebrate Eid this year since her mother is in the ICU. Zareen added it will be Eid for her when her mother returns home. "I used to eagerly wait for Eid as a child...It was a huge thing to receive ₹100 (as Eidi) and I'd always save the money," she said.

80.title: Madras HC summons Dhanush after couple claims he is their son
80.article_body: Actor Dhanush has been summoned by the Madras High Court after a couple moved the court claiming that he is their son. Kathiseran and his wife Meenakshi have claimed that Dhanush had submitted forged documents of paternity test. Their case was earlier dismissed in 2020 saying that there were no supporting documents to prove that the paternity documents were forged.

81.title: Will support Sweden & Finland if they apply to join NATO: Germany
81.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz said on Tuesday that the country will back Finland and Sweden's potential bid for NATO membership, adding that no one can assume Russia won't attack other countries. "[Putin] wants to expand his territory...push borders with violence," he added. Scholz's remarks come amid reports that Sweden and Finland are likely to apply for NATO membership in May.

82.title: Man tries to set police chowky on fire in Mumbai's Mira Road; arrested
82.article_body: A 30-year-old man has been arrested for trying to burn down a police chowky in the Shanti Park area of Mumbai's Mira Road. The accused, Sunny Sadanand Kadam, used petrol from the fuel tank of one of the patrolling bikes to set the chowky on fire. Passers-by not only doused the fire but also caught Kadam on the spot.

83.title: Actor Oscar Isaac wears a dress at Met Gala, his wife Elvira wears a suit; fans react
83.article_body: Marvel's Moon Knight actor Oscar Isaac attended the Met Gala wearing a white tie and tails tailored dress, while his filmmaker-wife Elvira Lind wore a suit. Both of them wore outfits designed by Thom Browne. "Looking super stylish...love seeing men in skirts," an Instagram user commented. "Well played, they both look stunning," another comment read

84.title: Mumbai Police seizes loudspeakers from MNS office, detains Chandivali party unit chief
84.article_body: Mumbai Police on Tuesday seized loudspeakers from the office of Raj Thackeray-led Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) in Chandivali and detained party's unit chief Mahendra Bhanushali, among other leaders. Police have also issued notices to at least 100 people. The move comes after Thackeray asked people to play Hanuman Chalisa outside mosques from May 4 if loudspeakers there were not removed.

85.title: Shivaji memorial at Raigad Fort wasn't built by Lokmanya Tilak: Sambhaji
85.article_body: BJP MP Sambhaji Chhatrapati has reacted to MNS chief Raj Thackeray's statement that Lokmanya Tilak built Chhatrapati Shivaji's memorial at Raigad Fort near Pune. "I can state with some authority that Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj's memorial was not built by Lokmanya Tilak," he said. Sambhaji is a descendant of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj and the great-grandson of Chhatrapati Shahu Maharaj.

86.title: 4 men arrested for ATM card cloning in Mumbai
86.article_body: At least four men were arrested by the Mira-Bhayandar, Vasai-Virar (MBVV) police for cloning ATM cards and withdrawing money. Acting on secret information, the police arrested Saurabh Yadav, who informed them about his three aides, leading to their arrest. Three laptops, four ATM card cloners, eight ATM card skimming devices and five mobile phones were recovered from the accused.

87.title: Delhi Police arrests 114, recover 4.6 kg of drugs in last 24 hrs
87.article_body: Delhi Police arrested 114 persons for robbery, snatching, liquor smuggling and recovered 4.6 kilograms of narcotics substances in the last 24 hours, according to data released by their official Twitter account. Moreover, Delhi Police arrested 12 proclaimed offenders, seized 174 quarters of illicit liquor and recovered 19 stolen vehicles. Emergency help was given on 5,422 calls, the post added.

88.title: People in Delhi used to taunt us saying 'Sachin and his parents are going': Sanju Samson
88.article_body: Cricketer Sanju Samson recalled how his parents used to face taunts during his earlier days in Delhi. "Our parents used to carry...our kit bags as [me and my brother] were very young. People would remark 'Sachin and his parents are going...He'll become Tendulkar'," he said. Samson added, "A lot of fun was made at them like this...but they were confident."

89.title: DC's 22-year-old opener Prithvi Shaw buys apartment in Mumbai for ₹10.5 crore: Report
89.article_body: DC opener Prithvi Shaw has bought a flat in Mumbai's Bandra West for ₹10.5 crore, Moneycontrol reported. The unit with a 2,209-sq ft carpet area and a terrace of 1,654-sq ft was registered on April 28, the report added. The 22-year-old cricketer, who has scored 259 runs in IPL 2022 so far, was retained by DC for ₹7.5 crore.

90.title: Denmark PM gives PM Modi tour of her house, pics show painting he gifted her last year
90.article_body: After receiving PM Narendra Modi at the Copenhagen airport on Tuesday, Danish PM Mette Frederiksen gave him a tour of her official residence. She also showed the Pattachitra painting from Odisha gifted by PM Modi during her visit to India last year. Both the Prime Ministers also addressed a joint press meet.

91.title: Maratha Mandir executive director refuses to screen 'Doctor Strange 2'
91.article_body: G7 multiplex and Maratha Mandir Cinema's executive director, Manoj Desai, refused to screen 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness'. He stated the booker of their cinema had said the film will be given to them if they increase the ticket fee by ₹30. "Managing director of our cinema isn't in favour of increasing rates by even ₹1," he added.

92.title: MNS bagged a contract from BJP to disturb peace in Maha: Sanjay Raut
92.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Tuesday said that Maharashtra Navnirman Sena bagged a contract from BJP to disturb peace in Maharashtra. "The government must find out the political party that has given the contract to the 'Hindu Owaisi' to disturb the peace and harmony in the state. The government is standing on solid footing," Raut said.

93.title: 24 Rohingyas, including 10 children, held in Tripura
93.article_body: The Tripura Police on Tuesday said that 24 Rohingya immigrants, including 10 children, were detained in the state's Unakoti district on Monday. The BSF had intercepted the migrants in three cars near a checkpoint, they added. The Rohingyas, who had arrived in the state from Jammu, were planning to cross into Bangladesh through the border at Kailashahar, according to sources.

94.title: Hope to swiftly conclude talks on India-EU Free Trade Agreement: PM
94.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday said he hopes that negotiations on the India-EU Free Trade Agreement will be concluded swiftly. Speaking at the joint press meet with Danish PM Mette Frederiksen, PM Modi said, "We stressed on the need to ensure a free, open, inclusive and rules-based Indo-Pacific region." We also appealed for a ceasefire in Ukraine, he added.

95.title: Like US & Israel, India now retaliates if someone meddles with our borders: Shah
95.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday said that like US and Israel, India now retaliates whenever someone meddles with our borders. "Earlier only two nations, the United States of America and Israel, used to retaliate whenever someone meddled with their borders and military. Now due to Prime Minister Narendra Modi, our great nation India has joined that group," he stated.

96.title: Fan asks Kartik why he was in economy not business class, he responds
96.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan took to Instagram to share a video showing clips of him promoting his upcoming film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. He could be seen sitting in the economy class of an Indigo aircraft on his way to Chandigarh. A fan commented, "Why Kartik Aaryan not travelled in business class?" to which Kartik responded, "Ticket mehengi thi (Ticket was expensive)."

97.title: Ex-Cong MLA Ashwin Kotwal joins BJP ahead of Gujarat Assembly polls
97.article_body: Ahead of the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections, former Congress MLA Ashwin Kotwal joined the BJP on Tuesday. The ex-Khedbrahma MLA tendered his resignation to the Gujarat Legislative Assembly Speaker Nimaben Acharya earlier today. Kotwal, who hails from the tribal community, said that he was "very upset" with Congress, adding that the party "pretends to be within tribal society".

98.title: India's GDP to not reach $5 trillion before FY29: IMF data
98.article_body: India may only become a $5-trillion economy in FY29, data from IMF's World Economic Outlook Database suggested. As per the data, which doesn't go beyond FY28, India's nominal GDP is seen rising to $4.92 trillion in FY28. Earlier this year, Chief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran had said India would become a $5-trillion economy by FY26 or the following year.

99.title: LIC IPO undervalued, shares being offered at throwaway prices: Cong
99.article_body: Congress General Secretary Randeep Surjewala on Tuesday said the LIC IPO is undervalued and that shares are being offered at throwaway prices. Surjewala also asked why LIC's valuation was reduced from ₹12-14 lakh crore to ₹6 lakh crore in just two months. "Why is government trying to sell LIC when domestic and global financial markets are in turmoil?" Surjewala said.

100.title: If Mohsin keeps working hard, he'll become a very good player: Gambhir
100.article_body: Calling Mohsin Khan a "standout player", LSG mentor Gautam Gambhir said the pacer's "unbelievable" bowling spell of 4-0-16-4 turned the match in their favour against DC in IPL 2022. "If the guy [Mohsin] keeps working hard, he would probably become a very good player," he added. Mohsin was adjudged 'Player of the Match' in LSG's six-run win over DC.

101.title: Tickets in Hyd's 1st class suburban trains to be cheaper by 50% from May 5
101.article_body: A 50% cut in the basic first-class ticket fares has been announced in Hyderabad's suburban MMTS (multi-modal transport system) train network from May 5 (Thursday). The minimum charge for up to 10 km will now be ₹25 as compared to ₹50 earlier. The maximum fare for 36-45 km distance has been reduced to ₹90 from ₹155.

102.title: BJP bulldozing India's secular nature, making mini-Pakistans: Mufti
102.article_body: BJP is "bulldozing the secular nature of the country and in the process making many Pakistans within India", said former Jammu and Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti. "They have failed on all fronts, whether it is employment or inflation, the only thing they are using now is the Hindu-Muslim divide," she said. They have no vision for the county, she added.

103.title: India appealed to take path of dialogues for solution in Ukraine: PM in Denmark
103.article_body: PM Narendra Modi while speaking in Copenhagen, Denmark said India made an appeal to take the path of dialogues and strategy for an immediate ceasefire and solution to the problem in Ukraine. He was speaking at the joint press meet with Danish PM Mette Frederiksen. PM Modi added that over 200 Danish companies are working in different sectors in India.

104.title: Thane police books woman for cheating 12 railway job aspirants of ₹59 lakh
104.article_body: Police in Thane have registered a case against a woman for allegedly cheating 12 people of ₹59 lakh after promising them jobs in the Railways. The woman had given appointment letters to the victims in sealed envelopes. When the job aspirants reported for work at the Central Railway's office, they were told the appointment letters were fake, an officer said.

105.title: I try to push limits to see what I'm capable of: Wrestler Ravi Dahiya
105.article_body: Wrestler Ravi Kumar Dahiya, who became India's first-ever three-time Asian champion, said since he's young (24-year-old), he tries to push the limits to see what he's capable of as he doesn't want to have any regrets later. The Tokyo Olympics silver medallist won his third consecutive gold in 57kg category at 2022 Asian Championships in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia, last month.

106.title: 'Jai Bhim' wins Best Film at Dadasaheb Phalke Int'l Film Festival
106.article_body: Actor Suriya's 'Jai Bhim' has won the award for Best Feature Film at the 12th Dadasaheb Phalke International Film Festival. Actor Manikandan also won the award for Best Supporting Actor for his role in the film. "Thank you @dadasahebfest for the honour," 2D Entertainment tweeted. The film was also sent to the Oscars, however, it did not earn a nomination.

107.title: Merchandise exports rise 24.2% to $38 bn in April, imports grow 26.6%
107.article_body: India's merchandise exports rose 24.22% YoY from $30.75 billion in April 2021 to $38.19 billion in April 2022, Commerce Ministry's preliminary data showed. Imports in April 2022 grew 26.55% YoY to $58.26 billion while trade deficit widened to $20.07 billion against $15.29 billion in April 2021. Petroleum and crude products accounted for 33.5% of imports in April this year.

108.title: Putin has to end the killings, I hope India will influence Russia: Denmark PM
108.article_body: Speaking about Russia-Ukraine war on Tuesday, Danish PM Mette Frederiksen said, "My message is very clear- Putin has to stop this war and end the killings. I hope that India will influence Russia also in this discussion." Frederiksen said this while issuing a statement at a joint press meet with PM Narendra Modi during his first visit to Denmark.

109.title: BJP leading double lives with beer in teapots: Mahua on Rahul's video
109.article_body: TMC leader Mahua Moitra reacted to criticism after Congress' Rahul Gandhi was seen at a nightclub in Nepal. "How on earth is it anybody’s business whether Rahul...or anybody else is in nightclub or at wedding in private time?" she asked. "Sick BJP trolls...should stick to doing what they do best- leading double lives with beer in teapots," she added.

110.title: Special gesture: India as Denmark PM personally comes to receive PM Modi at airport
110.article_body: After Denmark PM Mette Frederiksen personally came to receive PM Narendra Modi at the Copenhagen airport on Tuesday, External Affairs Ministry's Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said, "Heartwarming to see this special gesture from our Green Partner." It is PM Modi's first visit to Denmark, where he will hold bilateral and multilateral talks.

111.title: Ahead of PM Modi's visit, France's Naval Group backs out of key submarine project
111.article_body: Ahead of PM Narendra Modi's visit to Paris, France's Naval Group said it's unable to participate in Centre's P-75(I) project, under which 6 conventional submarines are to be domestically built for Indian Navy. "The present Request of Proposal requires that the fuel cell AIP (air independent propulsion)...be sea proven...The French Navy doesn't use such propulsion system," an official stated.

112.title: It's a free country: Musk on potential exodus of Twitter employees
112.article_body: Elon Musk said it's a "free country" after he was asked about a potential exodus of Twitter employees following his takeover on Met Gala's red carpet. "Certainly if anyone doesn't feel comfortable...they'll on their own accord go somewhere else. That's fine," Musk stated. As per Guardian, Twitter workers had raised questions about job security at a recently held company-wide meeting.

113.title: India's richest man's Adani Wilmar buys several brands including 'Kohinoor' rice
113.article_body: India's richest man Gautam Adani's Adani Wilmar announced the acquisition of several brands, including the 'Kohinoor' brand from McCormick Switzerland GMBH. The financial details of the deal were undisclosed. The deal gives Adani Wilmar exclusive rights over the 'Kohinoor' basmati rice brand and 'Ready to Cook', 'Ready to Eat' curries & meals portfolio under the Kohinoor Brand umbrella in India.

114.title: Musk planning to put less of his money into buying Twitter: Report
114.article_body: The world's richest man Elon Musk, who struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion last month, is "tying up less of his wealth in the deal", Reuters reported. Musk is in talks with large investment firms and high net-worth individuals for the financing. The new financing, if secured, could reduce the $21 billion cash contribution committed by Musk.

115.title: Taiwan reduces quarantine for arrivals amid spike in COVID-19 cases
115.article_body: Taiwan said on Tuesday that it'll reduce mandatory quarantine period from 10 days to seven days for all arrivals from May 9 onwards. Additionally, arriving passengers will have to take an RT-PCR test upon reaching the country. The announcement comes at a time when Taiwan's experiencing a surge in COVID-19 cases with 23,139 new infections reported in last 24 hours.

116.title: Revise timings or advance summer holidays: Parents to Delhi govt
116.article_body: Parents have urged the Delhi government to either revise school hours or advance the summer vacation in view of extreme heat conditions. "During peak summer hours, students are out in the sun, which is really dangerous," said Delhi Parents Association President Aparajita Gautam. Preponing summer vacations isn't an option as schools have opened after a long period, a parent said.

117.title: Railways spent ₹150 cr to repair 2,000 wagons to transport coal
117.article_body: The Indian Railways has spent around ₹150 crore since January to repair over 2,000 wagons to expedite the transportation of coal to power plants, according to officials. An official claimed that the damage was caused by JCBs used by private contractors to unload coal at power plants. Currently, there is a power crisis in the country, leading to blackouts.

118.title: SRK is great: Benedict on his choice for Indian actor in MCU
118.article_body: 'Doctor Strange' actor Benedict Cumberbatch, in a recent interview, was asked which Indian actor could play a superhero in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. The British actor was given an option between Shah Rukh Khan and Hrithik Roshan. To this, Benedict replied, "[Shah Rukh] Khan is great." Earlier, Benedict spoke about India and said he loves the country and its cultures.

119.title: China sends aircraft carrier, vessels to seas near Japan
119.article_body: Japanese Defence Ministry said that eight Chinese Navy vessels, including an aircraft carrier and destroyers, sailed between Japan's Okinawa island and Miyakojima on Monday. However, the ministry added, there was no incursion into Japan's territorial waters. Reportedly, it is the first time that a Chinese aircraft carrier was confirmed to have passed through the area since December 2021.

120.title: FIR against Raj Thackeray over his speech at Aurangabad rally
120.article_body: A case has been registered against MNS chief Raj Thackeray over his speech at a public rally in Maharashtra's Aurangabad on May 1. The organisers of the rally have also been named in the FIR filed in Aurangabad. In the rally, Thackeray had asked his supporters to play Hanuman Chalisa outside mosques from May 4 if loudspeakers there weren't removed.

121.title: Man Utd would be 15th-16th or even lower in PL without Ronaldo: Ferdinand
121.article_body: Former Manchester United defender Rio Ferdinand said Manchester United would have been placed on the 15th or 16th position, or even lower in the Premier League this season, in the absence of Cristiano Ronaldo. "I will be absolutely shocked to the hilt if [new manager] Erik ten Hag comes in and says he can't work with Ronaldo," added Ferdinand.

122.title: Taliban tells driving teachers to stop issuing licences to women: Report
122.article_body: Taliban officials in Afghanistan's Herat have verbally instructed driving teachers to stop issuing licences to women, AFP reported. However, we've "not been directed to stop women from driving in the city", Jan Achakzai, head of Herat's Traffic Management Institute that oversees driving schools, said. Taliban has implemented new rules to restrict women's rights in Afghanistan since seizing power.

123.title: Maha police personnel's leaves cancelled amid Raj Thackeray's loudspeaker warning
123.article_body: Maharashtra DGP Rajneesh Seth on Tuesday, while appealing to citizens to maintain peace, informed that leaves of police personnel have been cancelled in view of the ongoing law and order situation in the state. MNS chief Raj Thackeray's speech calling for removal of loudspeakers from mosques is being looked into and legal action will be taken if needed, Seth added.

124.title: Russia claims it hit Ukraine logistics centre having US weapons
124.article_body: Russia has struck a military airfield near Ukraine's southwestern city of Odesa with missiles, the Russian Defence Ministry said on Tuesday. "Hangars containing unmanned Bayraktar TB2 drones as well as missiles and ammunition from the US and European countries were destroyed," it added. Russian missiles and artillery also hit several military targets across Ukraine, including command centres.

125.title: 1 arrested, 5 booked over child marriage in Rajasthan's Jhalawar
125.article_body: Rajasthan Police arrested one person and booked five others for allegedly arranging a child marriage in Rajasthan's Jhalawar last week. The matter came to light when a video clip of the minor couple entering into wedlock surfaced, police said. Accordingly, a case was registered against the accused under the Prohibition of Child Marriage Act, 2006.

126.title: Prisons shouldn't become centres for anti-national activities: MHA
126.article_body: The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) has written to all the states and Union Territories and their prison authorities to take effective steps to prevent prisons from becoming breeding grounds for anti-national activities. For this, the Ministry issued an order suggesting a regular inspection of prisons. Moreover, it also stressed on the need to strengthen security arrangements.

127.title: In our eyes we have found the best playing XI: KKR's Nitish Rana
127.article_body: Reacting to the criticism over the frequent changes in their playing XI, KKR batter Nitish Rana said if they keep winning, then any XI is the best. He added, "In our eyes, we've got the best XI, probably the outsiders feel that we haven't. The comfortable way in which we won [against RR]...means our playing XI is set," he added.

128.title: Wish my wife & kids had met you: Sanjay Dutt on Nargis' death anniversary
128.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt penned a note for his mother late actress Nargis on social media to mark her death anniversary. He wrote, "Not a single moment goes by when I don't remember you. Ma, you were the basis of my life and the strength of my soul. I wish my wife and kids would have met you."

129.title: Amazon to pay US staff travel expenses of up to $4,000 for abortions
129.article_body: Amazon will cover up to $4,000 per year in travel costs for US employees seeking non-life threatening medical treatments, including elective abortion and transgender care. As per the announcement, the benefits will apply to treatments that are not available inside a 100-mile radius of an employee's home. This comes amid rising restrictions for abortion procedures in the US.

130.title: Rajasthan CM instructs officials to head to Jodhpur following violence
130.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Tuesday convened high-level meeting with state's DGP, other officials on law and order situation following violence in Jodhpur. Gehlot directed officials, including Jodhpur in-charge Minister Dr Subhash Garg, to immediately head to city. Curfew has been imposed in 10 areas of Jodhpur as clashes broke out between two communities at Jalori Gate after Eid prayers.

131.title: Steps being taken in higher education to empower youth, says Amit Shah
131.article_body: Addressing the students of Nrupathunga University on Tuesday in Bengaluru, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that Prime Minister Narendra Modi is building infrastructure for higher education such that India's youth can stand at par with global levels. "The future of any country is built by the youth and their character," he added.

132.title: DCW rescues 5 minor boys from bangle making unit in Delhi
132.article_body: Five minor boys employed as child labour at a bangle making unit in Delhi's Jahangirpuri area were rescued by Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) on Monday. According to DCW, the children hailed from Bihar and had come to the national capital over a month ago to earn livelihood. "The boys...were beaten up frequently and mercilessly by their employer," DCW said.

133.title: Domestic mutual funds subscribe 71% of LIC IPO anchor book
133.article_body: Domestic mutual funds invested ₹4,002.27 crore, accounting for 71.12% of the total ₹5,627 crore that LIC IPO mobilised from anchor investors on Monday. The largest investor was SBI Mutual Fund, which invested ₹1,006.89 crore. Overall, LIC issued 59.29 million equity shares to 123 anchor investors at the upper price band of the offer of ₹949 per share.

134.title: Many times Lata didi felt she's an orphan: Hridaynath Mangeshkar
134.article_body: Speaking about her sister, late singer Lata Mangeshkar, Hridaynath Mangeshkar said, "Lata Mangeshkar didn't become Lata Mangeshkar just like that. She had to go through a lot...There were...many times she used to feel that she's an orphan, she has no one," he added. "And the way she stood up after being...broken is what makes her a legend," he added.

135.title: If they've a good story, I'll be there: Olsen on potential Scarlet Witch movie
135.article_body: Elizabeth Olsen, on being asked if Scarlet Witch will ever get a solo movie, said, "I don't know, but if they have a good story to tell, I'll be there." She made her Marvel Cinematic Universe debut in 2014 in the post-credit scene of 'Captain America: The Winter Soldier'. Olsen played one of the leads in the web series 'WandaVision'.

136.title: BJP leader Satish Poonia slams Congress over Rajasthan's law & order situation
136.article_body: Rajasthan BJP chief Satish Poonia slammed Congress-led state government over disrupted law and order situation in the state and said, "Why does this type of incident happen only during Congress rule?" Referring to violent incidents that took place on Ram Navami and Eid-ul-Fitr in Karauli and Jodhpur respectively, Poonia said, "Due to appeasement politics, peace...has been disturbed in the state."

137.title: Rival gang members attack man with beer bottles, machete inside Mysuru bar
137.article_body: Five members of a gang have been booked for attacking a rival gang member with beer bottles and a machete inside a bar in Karnataka's Mysuru. According to a police officer, the gang had an old rivalry with the victim, who is also a rowdy-sheeter. Two of the accused were arrested after CCTV camera captured the incident, police said.

138.title: Heard's op-ed piece on abuse was catastrophic for Depp's career: Actor's agent
138.article_body: Johnny Depp's ex-wife Amber Heard's 2018 op-ed piece about being a victim of domestic violence was "catastrophic" for his career, Depp's agent Jack Whigham told the jury on Monday in the defamation trial brought by the actor. He said Depp struggled to get any kind of work and had to take a pay cut to do the independent film 'Minamata'.

139.title: We're friends; we have healthy relationship: Terence on rumours of dating Nora
139.article_body: Choreographer Terence Lewis opened up about the rumours of him dating actress Nora Fatehi. He said, "We are very good friends," adding that there's nothing more to it. "I think we have got great chemistry on-screen. Most importantly, she is a very free-spirited person, and I also like her energy and vibe...We have a very healthy relationship," Terence said.

140.title: We're in a crisis, we've to make responsible choices: Bhumi on climate change
140.article_body: Speaking about climate change, actress Bhumi Pednekar said she doesn't use single use plastic in her daily life. "We're in a crisis, and...we've reached a tipping point. We've seen so many climate-related disasters in the last few years," she added. "We all have to make many conscious and responsible choices," Bhumi said.

141.title: The selectors are watching: Aakash on Shubman Gill's form in IPL 2022
141.article_body: Commentator Aakash Chopra has said GT opener Shubman Gill needs to start scoring in the ongoing IPL season as the selectors are watching. "GT are managing without big scores from Shubman...which is not a good thing for him," stated Aakash. So far, Shubman has scored 260 runs, crossing the fifty-run mark only twice in nine games.

142.title: India ranks 150 out of 180 nations on World Press Freedom Index; falls 8 spots
142.article_body: India has been ranked 150 on the 2022 edition of the World Press Freedom Index published by the international organisation Reporters Without Borders. India had ranked 142 in 2020 and 2021 on the index, which assesses the state of journalism in 180 countries and territories. Pakistan has been ranked 157 and China 175, while Norway has ranked 1.

143.title: Murray registers 1st win on clay in nearly 2 years, beats Thiem in Madrid
143.article_body: Wild card Andy Murray, playing in his first tournament on clay in nearly two years, defeated ex-world number three Dominic Thiem 6-3, 6-4 in first round at 2022 Madrid Open on Monday. Two-time champion Murray will face 14th-seeded Denis Shapovalov, who beat lucky loser Ugo Humbert of France, 7-6(7-1), 6-3. Murray played his last clay-court match at 2020 French Open.

144.title: PM Modi defamed past govts, hid BJP's failures in Berlin: Kharge
144.article_body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Tuesday criticised PM Narendra Modi for "defaming" past governments in order to hide the "shortcomings and failures" of the BJP-led Central government while addressing the crowd in Berlin during his Europe visit. It is not right for the PM to raise internal issues of India in other countries and criticise past governments, he said.

145.title: Student injured as fan falls on her during exam in Andhra Pradesh
145.article_body: A student at a local school in Andhra Pradesh's Sri Sathyasai district was injured after a ceiling fan fell on her while she was writing her examination. The girl was rushed to a hospital and rejoined after treatment. "It was an unfortunate incident. A proper installation and thorough maintenance will be carried out again," the school principal said.

146.title: Making funny faces at the Met: World's richest man Musk on his Met Gala video
146.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk responded to his video from the Met Gala, in which he was seen making goofy faces, by tweeting, "Making funny faces at the Met." Twitter account 'DogeDesigner' had shared the video with a tweet saying, "My entire net worth is in hands of this man." Musk attended the Met with his supermodel mother Maye Musk.

147.title: Fiji court rules US can seize Russian-owned superyacht
147.article_body: A Fijian court has given the US permission to seize a superyacht suspected of belonging to Russian oligarch Suleiman Kerimov. The US has imposed sanctions on Kerimov over the Russian invasion of Ukraine. Fiji police detained the Amadea, worth around $325 million, after it arrived in the country following an 18-day voyage across the Pacific from Mexico in mid-April.

148.title: SC directs Lakshadweep admin to include meat in mid-day meals
148.article_body: Supreme Court has directed Lakshadweep administration to continue with Kerala High Court's 2021 order directing it to include meat products in mid-day meals for school children. SC was hearing a plea challenging Lakshadweep administration's decision to close dairy farms and remove meat products from mid-day meals. "Issue notice, returnable in two weeks after the ensuing vacation," SC stated.

149.title: Hindi film industry is not over and it will never be: Lyricist Manoj
149.article_body: Lyricist Manoj Muntashir took to Twitter to share his opinion that the Hindi film industry is not over and it will never be. "It's good to read and know English but the day Hindi filmmakers start speaking in Hindi everyday, the soul of our films will rise," added Manoj in his tweet. "We'll be back with a bang," stated Manoj.

150.title: When Indian actors become successful, they only remember bad past: Amit Sadh
150.article_body: Actor Amit Sadh said that when Indian actors become successful, they only remember their bad pasts. "They don't talk about one good thing...I think they forget that someone (in their journey) did something good, which is why they are where they are. I believe that we as people have become cynical in life," he added.

151.title: Actress quits AMMA committee over inaction against Vijay Babu
151.article_body: Actress Maala Parvathi resigned from AMMA's (Association of Malayalam Movie Artists) internal complaints committee in protest against its inaction against rape-accused Vijay Babu. AMMA refused to take any disciplinary action against Vijay stating, "A person cannot be shown the door...on the sole ground that there is a complaint against him...We also have to protect a member of the association."

152.title: LGBTQ aspect of America Chavez's character is from comics: Kevin
152.article_body: Marvel Studios President Kevin Feige opened up about the LGBTQ origins of MCU superhero America Chavez in the film 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness'. "That aspect of America's character is from the comics. We always want to adapt them as well and...truthfully as we can," Feige stated. America Chavez, in the comics, is a lesbian character.

153.title: Will ask committee to immediately include Lord Parshuram's chapter in syllabus: MP CM
153.article_body: Addressing an event on occasion of Parshuram Jayanti, Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said, "I'll direct the course committee to immediately include chapter about Lord Parshuram in the syllabus." We have started recruitment of Sanskrit teachers and will ensure that no post for Sanskrit teachers are left vacant so that the work on teaching Sanskrit begins immediately, he added.

154.title: Heavy rainfall predicted in several states; IMD releases list
154.article_body: The India Meteorological Department has predicted heavy rainfall in isolated areas of Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram, Tripura, Kerala on May 3 and 4. Heavy rainfall is also likely in regions in Tamil Nadu and Puducherry on May 5 and over Andaman and Nicobar Islands between May 4 and 7.

155.title: I'm very motivated and excited to be on Khatron Ke Khiladi 12: Rubina
155.article_body:
Actress Rubina Dilaik will be a part of stunt-based show 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 12'.
Speaking about it, she said, "I've endured many obstacles in life that...made me stronger and I'm very motivated and excited to be on 'Khatron Ke Khiladi'." "I'm confident that with Rohit Shetty's...guidance, I'll be able to achieve more than [what] I've set for myself," she added.

156.title: Not changing Pushpa 2's script after KGF 2's success: Producer refutes reports
156.article_body: Y Ravi Shankar, producer of Allu Arjun-starrer 'Pushpa: The Rise', has refuted reports claiming that the film's director Sukumar is making changes to the script of the sequel after the success of 'K.G.F: Chapter 2'. "What did KGF 2 do to affect our Pushpa 2? No changes, nothing. We've a high voltage script...why do we need to change...[it]?" Shankar said.

157.title: Car plunges into canal in Greater Noida, 1 dead
157.article_body: A 19-year-old man died after a car he was driving plunged into a canal in Greater Noida on Monday, leaving four others in the vehicle injured. The incident took place after the driver fell asleep at the wheel, the police said. The other passengers were rescued by locals and rushed to a hospital, they added.

158.title: Team of Pune doctors to hold musical event to raise funds for patients
158.article_body: A team of doctors, including a radiologist, an oral cancer surgeon and a paediatric surgeon, will organise a musical event in Pune on May 8 to raise funds for thalassemia patients. The doctors have performed in over 15 cities for various causes such as suicide prevention. They had conducted their first concert titled 'Nostalgia' in 2001.

159.title: 42-yr-old man stabs wife to death for refusing to go to work in TN
159.article_body: A 42-year-old man was arrested after he allegedly stabbed his wife to death in Tamil Nadu's Chennai for refusing to go to work. The wife apparently did so in order to be unable to give the accused money. The accused had got addicted to alcohol and reportedly fought with his wife when she refused to buy it.

160.title: US state stops all executions amid concerns of painful death by injections
160.article_body: The US' Tennessee has halted all executions till the end of 2022 amid concerns of painful death by lethal injections. Governor Bill Lee said an independent review of the procedures will be conducted before any more executions. "The use of the three-drug cocktail is incredibly problematic and in other states, has caused spectacular failures," said a Defence Attorney.

161.title: Mahela Jayawardena names his top 5 players for his dream T20 XI
161.article_body: In a recent episode of 'ICC Review', MI head coach Mahela Jayawardena nominated the first five players he'd pick if he was in charge of selecting a dream T20 side. Jayawardena named Afghanistan all-rounder Rashid Khan as his number one pick, followed by Pakistan pacer Shaheen Afridi, India pacer Jasprit Bumrah, England wicketkeeper Jos Buttler and Pakistan wicketkeeper Muhammad Rizwan.

162.title: No curfew relaxation in MP's Khargone on Eid, Akshaya Tritiya
162.article_body: The administration in Madhya Pradesh's Khargone decided not to relax the curfew on Tuesday and asked people to celebrate Eid-ul-Fitr and Akshaya Tritiya at home. The decision has been taken with the consent of people from all communities, the administration stated. Parts of Khargone have been under curfew since April 10, when communal violence erupted during a Ram Navami procession.

163.title: The day you love yourself, people will helplessly fall for you: Tejasswi
163.article_body: Sharing her opinion on body positivity, actress Tejasswi Prakash said, "Body positivity is something...I very strongly encourage. If you want to be this person who is loved, start with loving yourself." "The day you love yourself for the way you are, people will helplessly fall for you," added Tejasswi. "Love's...not about how beautiful you look from the outside," stated Tejasswi.

164.title: Punjab land of martyrs; seeds of hatred don't bloom here: CM Mann
164.article_body: CM Bhagwant Mann on Tuesday said that Punjab is a land of gurus and martyrs, adding that seeds of hatred don't bloom in the state. "Punjab's social bonding is very strong. We live in brotherhood and those who spread hatred find no place here," he said. Mann added the people will see a more vibrant Punjab in the coming years.

165.title: All will be well if power is given to people: Ghulam Nabi Azad on J&K polls
165.article_body: Senior Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad on Tuesday said "all would be well" if elections are held in Jammu and Kashmir. "If election happens and...power is given in...hands of people, then I believe all will be well," he said. Notably, Home Minister Amit Shah had earlier said that elections will be held in the Union Territory following the delimitation process.

166.title: 198 birds suffer heatstroke in Gurugram; hospitalised
166.article_body: As many as 198 birds have been hospitalised in Gurugram due to heatstroke. Giving details, Dr Rajkumar of Gurugram's Charitable Bird Hospital said, "Since the beginning of last week of April, the cases of heatstroke in birds have increased." As per India Meteorological Department (IMD), the north Indian region has been reeling under an intense heatwave for weeks now.

167.title: Motion in Canada Parliament to declare Nov as Hindu Heritage Month
167.article_body: An Indo-Canadian lawmaker, Chandra Arya, has moved a motion in Canada's Parliament to declare November as Hindu Heritage Month. The motion calls to "recognise the contributions that Hindu-Canadians have made to the socio-economic development of Canada…the richness of Hindu Heritage and its vast contribution to the world of arts and science...and its culture and traditions."

168.title: PM Modi arrives in Denmark, Danish PM receives him at Copenhagen airport
168.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday arrived in Denmark's Copenhagen on the second leg of his visit to three European nations. The PM was received at the Copenhagen airport by his Danish counterpart Mette Frederiksen. PM Modi is scheduled to hold talks with Frederiksen and attend the second India-Nordic Summit. He is also slated to visit Danish Queen Margrethe II.

169.title: Thar is Harsh Varrdhan's film, we're just supporting actors: Anil on son
169.article_body: Speaking about his upcoming film 'Thar', with actor Anupam Kher, actor Anil Kapoor said, "It's a different kind of movie. The trailer has received a good response." Anupam then said, "Harsh ki film hai (It's Harsh's film)." Reiterating the same statement, Anil said, "Harsh ki film hai. Hum to...supporting actors hain (It's Harsh's film. We're just supporting actors)."

170.title: Home Minister Amit Shah pays tribute to Lingayat saint Basaveshwara in B'luru
170.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah paid floral tributes to the bust and statue of Lingayat saint Basaveshwara on his birth anniversary as he arrived in Bengaluru on Tuesday. Tweeting photos from the event, Shah hailed the saint and wrote, "He devoted his entire life to the service of humanity...His great teachings on harmony, brotherhood and compassion...continue to guide us."

171.title: Referring to people around, not those behind devices: Nimrat on weight gain post
171.article_body: Actress Nimrat Kaur said that it wasn't online trolls who spoke about her weight gain during shooting of 'Dasvi'. "It was something...I experienced personally in day-to-day life...I am referring to people who were around me...not those who are hiding behind gadgets," she added. She also said that such people have been conditioned to feel they can say anything to anyone.

172.title: Rahul & Priyanka Gandhi do part-time politics: BJP's Rajyavardhan
172.article_body: Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi do part-time politics, BJP MP Rajyavardhan Rathore said on Tuesday. "Rajasthan government is useless. Do as many press conferences or give as many justifications about his (Rahul Gandhi) partying as you want, why is your government not working on its responsibilities?" Rathore added.

173.title: Tanushree Dutta gets stitches after accident due to brake failure, shares pic of injury
173.article_body: Actress Tanushree Dutta recently met with a road accident on her way to a temple. Taking to Instagram, she revealed that the accident took place after the vehicle she was travelling in had a brake failure. "Got away with just a few stitches," Tanushree further wrote while sharing a photo of her injury.

174.title: Israel supports 'neo-Nazi regime' in Ukraine: Russia amid Hitler row
174.article_body: Russia on Tuesday accused Israeli government of supporting "neo-Nazi regime in Kyiv", a day after the latter denounced Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov's comparison of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy with Adolf Hitler. Israeli Foreign Minister Yair Lapid had termed Lavrov's remarks as "unforgivable". Lavrov in an interview claimed that like Zelenskyy, "Hitler also had Jewish blood".

175.title: Activision shares rise after Buffett reveals owning 9.5% stake
