175.article_body: Shares of Activision Blizzard rose nearly 3% on Monday after billionaire investor Warren Buffett said his company Berkshire Hathaway owned a 9.5% stake worth $5.6 billion in the video game maker. Activision shares were up $2.13, or 2.8%, at $77.73. However, this was still lower than the $95/share Microsoft offered as part of its $68.7 billion proposal to buy Activision.

176.title: 25-yr-old man killed, 3 injured as relatives clash at a wedding in UP
176.article_body: A 25-year-old man was killed and three others were injured after a clash broke out between relatives and friends of the bride and the groom at a wedding in Uttar Pradesh's Sonbhadra. Police said some guests of the groom allegedly misbehaved with female dancers at around 10 pm on Monday. The bride's side objected to this, leading to a fight.

177.title: If a wicket falls in 11th over, RR need to get Hetmyer out there: Gavaskar
177.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar has questioned RR's decision to send Shimron Hetmyer only after the loss of four wickets against KKR on Monday. "The man is in form, even if a wicket falls in the 11th over, get him out there," stated Gavaskar. Hetmyer came in to bat in the 18th over and smashed 27*(13) to help RR post 152/5.

178.title: Man held over 2 months after rape victim's body was found in shop in Delhi
178.article_body: A 32-year-old man was arrested on Tuesday for allegedly raping and killing a 14-year-old girl in Delhi's Narela on February 12, police said. The victim's partially decomposed body was earlier found under a heap of cow dung cakes kept in gunny bags in a shop, police added. Before his arrest, the accused fired at the police, DCP (Outer North) said.

179.title: The love for MS Dhoni is unreal, Pune was on fire for him: Pooran
179.article_body: SRH wicketkeeper-batter Nicholas Pooran took to Instagram to share that the love for MS Dhoni is "unreal", adding it's "absolutely electrifying" when Dhoni is in the stadium. "Pune was on fire for him," stated Pooran in his post. The Maharashtra Cricket Association Stadium in Pune hosted the IPL 2022 match between SRH and CSK which SRH lost by 13 runs.

180.title: Non-bailable warrant issued against Raj Thackeray in 14-yr-old case in Maha
180.article_body: A court in the Sangli district of Maharashtra has issued a non-bailable warrant against MNS chief Raj Thackeray for allegedly making inflammatory speeches in 2008. The Judicial Magistrate issued the warrant against Thackeray and his party colleague Shirish Parkar. The court has asked Mumbai Police to implement the warrant before June 8 and produce both the leaders before the court.

181.title: Charak oath was our decision: TN medical college student council head
181.article_body: The student council president of the government-run medical college in Tamil Nadu's Madurai has said that the council had decided to administer 'Charak Shapath' instead of Hippocratic oath to first-year students. The council's president added that this was done "as it was recommended by the National Medical Commission". Furthermore, the council said that the college wasn't responsible for the act.

182.title: T'gana HC orders IAS officer to refund ₹15 lakh to govt over defamation case
182.article_body: The Telangana High Court has directed an IAS officer to refund ₹15 lakh sanctioned to her by the state government for meeting legal expenses in a defamation case against an English magazine. The court noted that it is a case where the IAS officer had participated in a private event, and asked her to pay the amount within 90 days.

183.title: Fans mistake Met Gala attendee wearing silver bodysuit for actor Jared Leto
183.article_body: Several fans mistook entrepreneur and self-proclaimed fashion addict Fredrik Robertsson for actor Jared Leto after he arrived at Met Gala. He wore a silver Iris van Herpen jumpsuit. "I love Jared Leto but this outfit confuses me," a Twitter user wrote. "Jared Leto...literally is one of like 5 men who actually does more than a black suit," another tweet read.

184.title: Indian wives possessive about husbands, jolt for them if he's shared by another lady: HC
184.article_body: Hearing a case of a man accused of abetting wife's suicide, Allahabad High Court's Justice Rahul Chaturvedi observed, "[Indian wives] are literally possessive about their husband. It'd be a biggest jolt for any married woman that her husband is being shared by some other lady." The man's wife had died by suicide allegedly because he was marrying another woman.

185.title: Tech blogger shares a glimpse of what Twitter's edit button could look like
185.article_body: Jane Manchun Wong, known for finding hidden features in companies' code, shared a glimpse of what she claims Twitter's edit button could look like. The Edit Tweet button allows users to create a new tweet with different content and a label saying 'Edited' appears at the bottom of edited tweet. Currently, users will have 30 minutes to make tweet edits.

186.title: Assistant loco pilot delays train by an hour after he goes for drinking in Bihar
186.article_body: A local train in Bihar was held up for nearly an hour on Monday after the assistant loco pilot went missing. He was eventually tracked down by the government railway police (GRP) but he was too drunk to get back to the train, Hindustan Times reported. Samastipur divisional railway manager Alok Agarwal said he has sought a detailed report.

187.title: Rohit Roy to star in Sam Bhattacharjee's Indo-British sci-fi film 'IRaH'
187.article_body: Actor Rohit Bose Roy is set to make his international debut with a sci-fi thriller, titled 'IRaH'. The upcoming film, an Indo-British production, will be directed by Sam Bhattacharjee. Rohit will play a manipulative, narcissistic CEO of a tech company, who creates an AI-based application - IRaH 5.10, through which a person can effectively achieve immortality by archiving oneself.

188.title: Smriti Irani visits Rahul Gandhi's constituency Wayanad to review development
188.article_body: Union Minister for Women and Child Development Smriti Irani reached Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's Lok Sabha constituency Wayanad in Kerala to review developmental projects in the district. Prior to her arrival in Wayanad, Irani took to Twitter and said, "Hello Wayanad! I will be there soon to attend meetings and other public events related to the development of the district."

189.title: Govt sets 19-million-tonnes coal import target for end-June: Report
189.article_body: The Centre has asked state and private-sector power utilities to ensure delivery of 19 million tonnes of coal from overseas by end-June, Reuters reported citing a letter from the Power Ministry. Public-sector utilities have been asked to import over 22 million tonnes of coal, while private-sector utilities have been asked to import a total of 15.94 million tonnes of coal.

190.title: PMPML starts e-bus services to Sinhagad fort, two-way fare at ₹100
190.article_body: PMPML commenced e-bus services to the Sinhagad fort on Monday, a day after it was inaugurated by Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar. The buses will pick up people from the foothills of the fort and its two-way fares have been fixed at ₹100 for adults and ₹50 for children. Private vehicles won't be allowed on hilltop to curb parking issues.

191.title: Masked men enter school and beat students in Gurugram
191.article_body: Masked men entered a school in Gurugram's Abhaypur village and assaulted students of Class 12 with sticks on Monday, according to the police. Nine students, including five girls, were admitted to a hospital after the incident, the police said. "As per the complaint of the teacher, an FIR has been registered against 15 accused," a police official said.

192.title: The one & only: Kareena on Natasha Poonawalla's Met Gala 2022 look
192.article_body: Indian businesswoman Natasha Poonawalla attended Met Gala 2022 event and donned a golden saree with a bustier. Her golden look for the event, which was designed by Sabyasachi Mukherjee and the house of Schiaparelli, received praises from actors Kareena Kapoor, Karisma Kapoor and Malaika Arora. Taking to Instagram Stories, Kareena wrote, "The one and only. Ufffff. Love love love."

193.title: Way Rinku maintained his calm under pressure vs RR was outstanding: Shreyas
193.article_body: Praising Rinku Singh for his unbeaten 23-ball 42, which includes six fours and one six, in KKR's seven-wicket win against RR in IPL 2022, KKR skipper Shreyas Iyer said the 24-year-old batter showed "outstanding" calmness under pressure. "He's a great asset for the future in...franchise," he added. Rinku and Nitish Rana (48*) helped KKR chase 153-run target in 19.1 overs.

194.title: Rahul parties more & works less: BJP's Shahnawaz on viral video
194.article_body: After a video went viral showing Congress leader Rahul Gandhi at a nightclub in Kathmandu, BJP leader Syed Shahnawaz Hussain said Gandhi parties more and works less for his party. "He parties every day, no one stops him anyway," Hussain added. "The Constitution doesn't have any such rule where anyone can be stopped from partying," Hussain stated.

195.title: 1 killed as speeding 2-wheeler hits scooty, Cyberabad Police shares video
195.article_body: The Cyberabad Traffic Police has shared a video showing a speeding two-wheeler crashing into a scooter on Nalsar Cross Road in Shamirpet. The pillion rider lost his life, the police said, adding that he was not wearing a helmet. The police cautioned the citizens against abruptly changing lane and over speeding.

196.title: 3 men rob 23-yr-old taxi driver of his vehicle, cash in Ludhiana
196.article_body: Three men impersonated as passengers and robbed a 23-year-old taxi driver of his vehicle and ₹2,000 cash in Ludhiana. The accused threatened the taxi driver with sharp-edged weapons on the national highway near Ladhowal on Sunday. An FIR has been registered against the unidentified accused persons. Police are scanning closed-circuit television cameras to trace the accused.

197.title: Amit Shah lays foundation stone for Nrupathunga University in B'luru
197.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday laid the foundation stone for the Nrupathunga University in Bengaluru. He also virtually inaugurated the Forensic Science Laboratory in Ballari. "Under PM Modi's leadership, we're building infra for higher education," Shah said. "In the journey of 75 years, the country has crossed a lot of destinations and we're standing here today," he added.

198.title: Cong responds after Rahul seen at nightclub, says 'attending wedding part of our culture'
198.article_body: Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala has responded to criticism after Rahul Gandhi was seen at a nightclub in Kathmandu, saying that Rahul went to Nepal to attend the wedding of a friend, who is a journalist. "Last I checked, having family and friends and attending marriage ceremonies is a matter of our culture and civilisation," Surjewala said.

199.title: Russia plans to annex parts of eastern Ukraine: US
199.article_body: The US has warned that Moscow is planning to formally annex parts of eastern Ukraine, specifically the regions of Luhansk and Donetsk, later this month. Russia also has a similar plan for Kherson region, Michael Carpenter, US ambassador to the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe, said. Neither move would be recognised by America or its allies, he added.

200.title: CCTV footage of Chennai police chasing alleged custodial death victim surfaces
200.article_body: Days after a 25-year-old man died due to alleged custodial torture by police personnel in Chennai, a CCTV footage purportedly showing policemen chasing and beating him has surfaced online. The deceased's brother earlier claimed that police had offered their family money in an attempt to cover up the truth. Police had claimed that the man died due to a seizure.

201.title: We will not support sanctions on Russian oil & gas: Hungary
201.article_body: Hungarian Foreign Minister Peter Szijjarto on Tuesday said that Hungary will not support the European Union's sanctions that would make Russian oil and gas shipments to the country impossible. Russian oil shipments via the Druzhba pipeline account for about 65% of the oil Hungary needs and there are no alternative supply routes to replace that, he added.

202.title: Pune man cheats employees of ₹28 lakh provident fund money; booked
202.article_body: A security company's director in Pune's Bhosari has been booked for allegedly cheating his employees of ₹28.3 lakh by diverting funds from provident fund payments. The company allegedly deducted money from employees' salaries on pretext of provident fund deposits, however, the amount wasn't transferred to their EPFO accounts. The director has been accused of using the money for personal needs.

203.title: Camila, Shawn make solo appearances at Met Gala 2022 post break up
203.article_body: Former couple Camila Cabello and Shawn Mendes attended the Met Gala 2022 separately. Shawn walked the red carpet wearing a navy and burgundy suit jacket, while Camila donned a white lace-up crop top paired with a full skirt. Pictures of the duo, making solo appearances surfaced online. Commenting on them, a user wrote, "It was...September 2021 when they appeared together."

204.title: Over 200 civilians still trapped at Mariupol steel plant: Mayor
204.article_body: The Mayor of Ukraine's Mariupol, Vadym Boychenko, has said that over 200 civilians are still trapped at the Azovstal steel plant in the city. This comes after several Ukrainians were rescued in a United Nations-led evacuation mission on Monday. A Ukrainian fighter has also made a similar claim saying that women, children and elderly people couldn't be rescued.

205.title: Less than 5% of users are fake or spam accounts: Twitter
205.article_body: False or spam accounts represented less than 5% of Twitter's 229 million monetisable daily active users in Q1, the company estimated in a filing. This comes after Elon Musk, who's buying Twitter for $44 billion, said one of his priorities will be to remove "spam bots" from Twitter. Around 48% of Musk's Twitter followers are fake, TIME magazine recently reported.

206.title: Police constable injured in encounter with Naxals in Maharashtra
206.article_body: A police constable suffered serious injuries in an encounter with Naxals in Maharashtra's Gadchiroli district on Tuesday, a senior official said. The encounter broke out when a team of C-60 commandos, a specialised combat unit of Gadchiroli police, was patrolling in the area. The Naxals opened fire at the police patrolling team, following which the security personnel retaliated.

207.title: Sexual exploitation of people in film industry is so common: Kangana
207.article_body: Kangana Ranaut, while hosting the reality show 'Lock Upp', said sexual exploitation of young people in the film and fashion industry is common. "While it gives so many opportunities, it also shatters many dreams and leaves people permanently scarred. It is the dark truth," Kangana added. Earlier, Kangana had revealed she was inappropriately touched when she was a child.

208.title: Data based on Centre's NPP: Satyendar Jain to Union Minister on 'wrong figures' remark
208.article_body: Responding to Union Power Minister RK Singh's claim that the coal stock data presented by Satyendar Jain had "incorrect" figures, the Delhi Power Minister said that the figures were taken from portal managed by Centre. The figures mentioned in my letter for some of the NTPC stations were based on daily coal report of National Power Portal, Jain said.

209.title: Curfew imposed in 10 areas in Jodhpur after clashes break out between 2 groups
209.article_body: Rajasthan's Jodhpur district administration has imposed a curfew from 1 pm on Tuesday till midnight on Wednesday in 10 police station areas. Internet services have also been suspended in Jodhpur. This comes after a stone-pelting incident and clashes between two communities at Jalori Gate broke out on Monday night. During the violence, many people were injured, including four police personnel.

210.title: Meghana remembers Chiranjeevi Sarja on wedding anniversary, pens note
210.article_body: Actress Meghana Raj Sarja took to Instagram on Monday to pen a note remembering her late husband, Chiranjeevi Sarja, on the occasion of their wedding anniversary. "The only reason I will ever forgive God is because I know he needs your guidance to make sure he does the right thing to Raayan (son) and me...Happy anniversary," Meghana wrote.

211.title: It's a bad precedent for Indian cricket: Ajay Jadeja on KKR dropping Venkatesh
211.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Ajay Jadeja has criticised KKR for dropping all-rounder Venkatesh Iyer for their match against RR. "There will always be a debate regarding selection. But if you start dropping players of the Indian team after just a handful of matches then you'll set a bad precedent," he stated. Iyer has scored 132 runs in nine matches so far.

212.title: Explosion at Pune eatery due to leaked LPG, 2 workers injured
212.article_body: Two workers of an eatery were injured in an explosion caused by leaked liquified petroleum gas (LPG) used for cooking in Pune district's Chinchwad area on Tuesday. The LPG cylinder did not explode, an official said. The incident took place at around 9 am when several people were having breakfast at the eatery.

213.title: 4000-kg sword for ₹85-crore Kempegowda statue arrives at B'luru airport
213.article_body: A 4,000-kilogram sword, which is part of the 108-foot-tall Kempegowda statue being constructed at Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport premises, arrived in a special truck from Delhi on Monday. Karnataka minister Ashwathnarayan CN welcomed the 35-foot-long sword and participated in a 'shakti puja' conducted by priests on the occasion. The statue is estimated to cost ₹85 crore.

214.title: KKR's Rinku shows he wrote 50 & heart on palm before Man of the Match performance vs RR
214.article_body: After winning the Man of the Match for his 42*(23) against RR, KKR batter Rinku Singh, in a video shared by IPL, showed he had scribbled 50 and heart sign on his palm ahead of the match. "I had a feeling since morning that I'll score runs and be Man of the Match...which is why I wrote this," Rinku said.

215.title: Let's win COVID battle like Harry Potter defeated Voldemort: Delhi Police
215.article_body: Amid the rise in COVID-19 cases in the national capital, Delhi Police shared a tweet on COVID-19 awareness."There is a surge in #COVID19 cases. Delhi Police urges everyone to mask up, maintain social distancing & avoid crowds. Let's work together to keep Delhi safe and win this battle just like #HarryPotter defeated Voldemort. Happy #HarryPotterDay!" the tweet read.

216.title: World's richest man Musk walks Met Gala red carpet with his supermodel mother
216.article_body: The world's richest man Elon Musk walked the Met Gala 2022 red carpet with his 74-year-old supermodel mother Maye Musk. On being asked why the world's richest man would make time for Met Gala, Musk responded, "My mom wanted to come, so I brought my mom. That's the reason." Elon wore a black tuxedo while Maye wore a Dior gown.

217.title: Will take action against Raj Thackeray today itself: Maha DGP
217.article_body: Maharashtra DGP Rajnish Seth said action will be taken against MNS chief Raj Thackeray on Tuesday itself based on his speech calling for removal of loudspeakers from mosques. "Aurangabad Commissioner is looking into the speech. He'll take whatever legal action that is needed," Seth said. We're prepared to deal with issues arising out of Thackeray's call for agitation, he added.

218.title: 19-year-old Stanford dropouts' Zepto raises $200 mn at $900 mn valuation
218.article_body: Ten-minute grocery delivery startup Zepto, founded by childhood friends Aadit Palicha and Kaivalya Vohra who dropped out of Stanford University, has raised $200 million in Series D round led by Y Combinator. The nine-month-old startup of Palicha and Vohra, both 19 years old, is now valued at $900 million. In its Series C round, Zepto was valued at $570 million.

219.title: Not a crime to attend friend's marriage: Surjewala on BJP criticising Rahul
219.article_body: After BJP leaders criticised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for being at a nightclub, the latter party's leader Randeep Surjewala said that Rahul was attending the marriage function of a journalist friend in Nepal and it's still "not a crime" to do so. "Maybe after today, BJP may decide it's illegal to attend...marriage and a crime to have friends," he added.

220.title: Kidnappers using civilians as human shields: Nigeria Prez on train attack
220.article_body: Nigerian President Muhammadu Buhari said that the armed gangs, who kidnapped dozens of people in a train attack weeks ago, were using civilians as human shields. It is causing difficulties for the military to conduct rescue operation, he said. "It's a delicate situation...Any rescue operation that results in the death of any hostage cannot be deemed a success," he added.

221.title: Model Cara Delevingne reveals her gold painted body at Met Gala, pics go viral
221.article_body: Supermodel Cara Delevingne showed up at the Met Gala red carpet in a red Dior Haute Couture suit and removed the jacket to reveal her naked torso covered in gold body paint. She wore a gold body chain that matched her body paint and she also partly covered her breasts. The theme for this year's Met Gala was 'Gilded Glamour'.

222.title: Kohli would be fuming that his 58 (53) wasn't enough to beat GT: Pietersen
222.article_body: Ex-RCB captain Kevin Pietersen said Virat Kohli would be "fuming" about his 53-ball 58 not being enough to help RCB beat GT in their IPL 2022 match. GT defeated RCB by six wickets. "I know Kohli is a champion [and]...a winner," added Pietersen. Kohli has scored 186 runs in IPL 2022 so far at a strike rate of 116.25.

223.title: BSF, Pak Rangers personnel exchange sweets on Eid at Attari border
223.article_body: The Border Security Force (BSF) and Pakistan Rangers personnel exchanged sweets at the JCP Attari border in Punjab on the occasion of Eid-ul-Fitr as part of the countries' traditions. They shook hands and greeted each other on the occasion. Personnel of the border guarding forces have been traditionally exchanging sweets on religious and national festivals of the two countries.

224.title: US Supreme Court set to strike down abortion rights: Report
224.article_body: The US Supreme Court appears set to vote to overturn the Roe v. Wade decision that legalised abortion nationwide, according to a leaked initial draft majority opinion published by Politico on Monday. "Roe was egregiously wrong from the start," conservative Justice Samuel Alito wrote in the draft opinion which is dated February 10, according to Politico.

225.title: Delhi Police arrests 2 more accused in Jahangirpuri violence case
225.article_body: Delhi Police on Monday arrested two more accused in connection with the communal violence that broke out in northwest Delhi's Jahangirpuri on April 16. One of the accused was seen distributing swords to the crowd in the footage from CCTV cameras, police said. Police have arrested a total of 33 people, including three juveniles, in the case so far.

226.title: 2 passengers run over by speeding train near Vapi station in Gujarat
226.article_body: Two passengers died after being run over by a speeding train near Vapi railway station in Gujarat's Valsad district, officials said. The incident occurred on Monday night when the deceased, who were relatives, were trying to board a Patna-bound train. They were run over by another train as they were crossing from the wrong side, an official said.

227.title: Protest at Pune university against Maha's decision on offline exams
227.article_body: Many students on Monday held a protest at Savitribai Phule Pune University against the Maharashtra government's decision to hold summer examinations in offline mode at universities across the state. Maharashtra NSUI President Amir Shaikh said that if "70% of the syllabus" was taught online then exams should also be online. Following this, SPPU Registrar Prafulla Pawar spoke to the students.

228.title: EC sends notice to Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren over mine lease
228.article_body: Election Commission (EC) on Monday issued a notice to Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren in connection with the mine lease case. EC has sought an explanation on why action should not be taken against him for allegedly having a mining lease issued in his favour. Prima-facie, Soren has violated Section 9A of the Representation of People's Act, EC stated.

229.title: 3 men returning from wedding function in UP die as bus hits motorcycle
229.article_body: Three men, who were returning from a wedding, were killed after a bus hit their motorcycle in Uttar Pradesh's Basti. The incident took place on the Lucknow-Gorakhpur national highway 28. The deceased have been identified as 20-year-old Niraj and Sandeep and 19-year-old Anil. The bodies have been sent for postmortem.

230.title: Jharkhand MLA Saryu Roy booked for allegedly leaking secret documents
230.article_body: Jharkhand Independent MLA Saryu Roy has been booked for allegedly leaking secret documents, an officer said on Tuesday. The FIR was lodged against the Jamshedpur (East) MLA by Under Secretary of state health department Vijay Varma. This comes almost three weeks after Roy accused state Health Minister Banna Gupta of corruption by misappropriating COVID-19 funds.

231.title: Researchers develop an enzyme that breaks down plastic in hours, not decades
231.article_body: Researchers have developed an enzyme that breaks down plastic waste in hours instead of decades at ambient temperatures. Developed from a natural PETase that allows bacteria to degrade plastic, the enzyme is named FAST-PETase (functional, active, stable and tolerant PETase). As per researchers, this enzyme breaks plastic down into its basic molecular units, which can be recycled into new products.

232.title: Pregnant Rihanna honoured with a statue at Met Gala 2022, pic surfaces
232.article_body: Singer Rihanna, who is pregnant, has been honoured with a marble statue by New York City's The Metropolitan Museum of Art at Met Gala 2022. The statue has been inspired by Rihanna's cover picture for Vogue US' May edition. "Shut down the met in marble...what’s more gilded than that? Lol...Thank you...for this historic tribute...y’all bad for this one!" Rihanna wrote

233.title: Dad fed & cleaned her, I'm sure he cried secretly: Namrata on mom Nargis' cancer
233.article_body: Sunil Dutt and Nargis' daughter Namrata recalled the time when her family had to move to the US during her mother's cancer treatment. "Dad was with her every single day from morning to night. He would feed her, clean her," she said. "I'm sure he cried secretly but dad never let us know what he was going through," added Namrata.

234.title: He hasn't done anything with either bat or ball: Gavaskar on Venkatesh
234.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said KKR all-rounder Venkatesh Iyer hasn't done anything with either bat or ball in IPL 2022 so far. "It could be a second season syndrome," added Gavaskar. Venkatesh has scored 132 runs in nine IPL 2022 matches so far at a strike rate of 97.77. He is yet to pick a wicket in IPL 2022.

235.title: BP, diabetes no grounds to refuse cancer cover: B'luru court to insurance firm
235.article_body: A Bengaluru court asked a private insurance firm to pay ₹6.7 lakh to a 60-year-old cancer patient to whom the firm denied insurance cover for cancer treatment on grounds that he had hypertension and diabetes. Hypertension and diabetes are not diseases but common physical disorders and they cannot be grounds to deny medical insurance, the court said.

236.title: Pregnant women with COVID-19 may be at risk of premature birth: Study
236.article_body: COVID-19 during pregnancy may lead to an increased risk of adverse maternal outcomes, ICU admissions, hospitalisations and preterm birth, a Canadian study has found. As per the study, these risks increase with age as well as comorbidities like high blood pressure.  The study, however, found that women who are fully vaccinated have a lower risk of experiencing these outcomes.

237.title: Justin Lin quit Fast X after 'major disagreement' with Vin Diesel: Report
237.article_body: Director Justin Lin quit 'Fast X' after a "major disagreement" with actor-producer Vin Diesel over script changes, according to a report. "Justin...had enough and said, 'This movie isn't worth my mental health,'" report quoted a source as saying. A Universal spokesperson, however, said that "any creative differences leading to Justin's exit were with studio, not with fellow producers or cast".

238.title: Man jailed for domestic violence, abetting wife's suicide in Hyd
238.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Monday said that a man has been imprisoned for three years on charges of domestic violence and abetting his wife's suicide. Rachakonda's Police Commissioner and Additional Police Commissioner appreciated the efforts of officials in convicting the accused and announced rewards for them, police added. The man reportedly harassed the deceased mentally and physically.

239.title: Australian man jailed for 12 yrs for murdering gay American man in 1988
239.article_body: A 51-year-old Australian man was sentenced to 12 years and seven months in prison for pushing and killing a gay American, Scott Johnson, off a Sydney cliff in 1988. Scott White was given a non-parole period of eight years and three months. Justice Helen Wilson said she didn't find beyond reasonable doubt that the murder was a gay hate crime.

240.title: 2 women, including friend, sedate & rob woman of ₹4 lakh jewellery in B'luru
240.article_body: A 30-year-old woman in Bengaluru was robbed of ₹4 lakh jewellery by two women, one of whom she claimed to be her friend. According to the complainant, on April 27, the duo turned up at her home and gave her a drink laced with sedatives, making her unconscious. They then stole her chain and other ornaments from the house.

241.title: PBKS' vehicle is always in 5th gear, they refuse to shift down: Pragyan Ojha
241.article_body: Ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha has said the Mayank Agarwal-led side is losing matches because of their over-aggressive approach in IPL 2022. “Their vehicle is always in fifth gear, they refuse to shift down to fourth gear...They need to play as per the game situation,” he added. PBKS are eighth on IPL points table with five defeats in nine games.

242.title: Censor Board wanted to ban Sarfarosh, remove words 'Pakistan', 'ISI': Director
242.article_body: Filmmaker John Matthew said that censors wanted to ban his film 'Sarfarosh' and felt it was going against the very concept of trying to be friendly with Pakistan. "Censor Board members wanted me to remove the word 'Pakistan' and 'ISI' from film...I was ready to go even to the Supreme Court...I stood my ground...(It) was released with words," he said.

243.title: One day I lost my mind after getting out, went to Marine Drive during the match: Samson
243.article_body: Cricketer Sanju Samson revealed he once lost his mind after getting out during a match, adding that he threw his bat in dressing room and left the stadium. "I walked out to Marine Drive and sat there looking at sea and thought, 'What's going on?'" Sanju added. He further said that he returned to the stadium after the match finished.

244.title: 28-yr-old woman slips on road, gets crushed under petroleum truck in Pune
244.article_body: A 28-year-old woman, who was riding a two-wheeler, was killed after getting crushed by a petroleum tanker truck near the Magarpatta area in Pune's Hadapsar. The woman had slipped on the road when the tanker came and mowed her further down, police said. The rear tyre of the petroleum truck grievously injured her and caused her instant death, police added.

245.title: PBKS cannot rely on any batter except Dhawan in tough situations: Tahir
245.article_body: Former CSK spinner Imran Tahir said PBKS cannot rely on any other batter except opener Shikhar Dhawan in challenging situations, terming it as a concern for the team. "If we remove Dhawan, no other batter has shown consistency," added Tahir. Dhawan has scored 307 runs in IPL 2022 so far at a strike rate of 126.33.

246.title: Aligarh Dharma Sabha organisers get notice over anti-minority remarks
246.article_body: The organisers of a religious event - Sanatan Dharma Sabha - held at Aligarh's Ramlila Ground were served with a show-cause notice by the district administration over remarks made against a minority community. The event was attended by religious leaders Yati Narsinghanand and Kalicharan Maharaj. The notice mentioned swords being brandished at the event despite a ban on carrying weapons.

247.title: Rahul Gandhi seen at nightclub in Kathmandu; video goes viral
247.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Congress leader Rahul Gandhi at a nightclub in Kathmandu. According to The Kathmandu Post, Gandhi arrived in the city to attend the wedding of his Nepali friend Sumnima Udas, a former CNN correspondent. The daily also quoted former Nepali Ambassador to Myanmar Bhim Udas as saying that Gandhi was invited to his daughter's wedding.

248.title: GT have snatched wins when defeat seemed imminent: Ajay Jadeja
248.article_body: Talking about GT's success in IPL 2022, ex-India batter Ajay Jadeja said it's not a team that plans and plays as per a set pattern. "Whichever player comes in is expected to do what is best for the team and what he's capable of," he explained. "They snatched wins in two-three games where defeat seemed imminent," Jadeja further said.

249.title: Before election mode, BJP workers get 3-day vacation in Gujarat
249.article_body: BJP's Gujarat leadership has given its workers a three-day break, from May 2 to 4, to spend time with their families before switching to election mode for the upcoming Assembly polls. There are no party functions in Gujarat till May 5, a senior BJP leader said. The workers have been working relentlessly for the last two years, he added.

250.title: Thane man, son rape mentally challenged daughter since 2017, get 10 yrs jail
250.article_body: A POCSO court has sentenced a 52-year-old man and his 25-year-old son to ten years in jail for allegedly raping the man's mentally challenged daughter on several occasions since 2017, when she was 15-years-old. The girl had told her neighbours after she got pregnant. The court has also imposed a fine of ₹5000 on both accused.

251.title: We'll fulfil what entire nation wants: 'Sarabhai...' producer on new season
251.article_body: Speaking about making a new season of 'Sarabhai Vs Sarabhai', producer JD Majethia, said some more time is needed to make a new season. "I agree with fans, a new season should be made. We will make all the efforts. Everybody is ready to extend their efforts," he added. "What the entire nation wants, [we'll] fulfil their wishes," he said.

252.title: Biden would love to visit Ukraine, but no current plans: White House
252.article_body: White House spokesperson Jen Psaki on Monday said US President Joe Biden would "love to visit Ukraine", but there are no current plans for him to do so. This comes after US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi paid a surprise visit to Ukraine. Psaki said the Biden administration wants to reopen US Embassy in Kyiv and have US diplomats on site.

253.title: Gujarat to mass promote Classes 1 to 8 students over pandemic
253.article_body: Gujarat Education Minister Jitu Vaghani announced on Monday that the state government has decided to mass promote students from Classes 1 to 8 regardless of marks due to the situation caused by the coronavirus pandemic. The notice said that although the second semester (annual) examinations have been completed in primary schools, the results will not affect the student's promotion.

254.title: Heatwave claims 25 lives in 2 months in Maha, highest deaths in Vidarbha
254.article_body: At least 25 people have died due to the heatwave in Maharashtra in two months which is the highest since 2016, state Health Department's Surveillance Officer Dr Pradeep Awate said. Vidarbha recorded the highest number of deaths at 15. "IMD said...there may be a respite from the heat as pre-monsoon showers are likely in many parts of Maharashtra," Awate added.

255.title: MP police buy bike for man delivering food on cycle; video surfaces
255.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh Home Department on Monday shared a video of Indore's Vijay Nagar police station officers gifting a bike to a 22-year-old online food delivery service employee. The police had decided to do so after seeing the man use a bicycle to deliver food. "We came to know that [the man's] family is facing financial problems," an official said.

256.title: Bikers attack student with knife after hitting him outside school in Delhi
256.article_body: A biker and his pillion reportedly attacked a student in Delhi's Mangolpuri on Monday. The boy told police he got into an argument with the accused after he was accidentally hit by their bike outside school, following which they called two other people and attacked him with a knife. As per medical reports, he has been hospitalised with non-superficial injuries.

257.title: I miss him with every breath of mine: Gauahar Khan on her father Zafar
257.article_body: Talking about her father Zafar Ahmed Khan who passed away in 2021, actress Gauahar Khan said, "I miss him with every breath of mine. There's not a minute...I don't think about him." "We don't realise what loss means to someone else until it actually hits us. You can...sympathise with people but you cannot feel what they feel," added Gauahar.

258.title: Country’s atmosphere not good, we want unity: Mamata on Eid
258.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday said the atmosphere of the country is not good. "Divide and rule policy is not good..Isolation policy is not good...We want unity," Banerjee added. She was addressing people at the Red Road in Kolkata on the occasion of Eid-ul-Fitr. "We are not scared, we know how to fight," Banerjee stated.

259.title: Security tightened near Jalori gate, Jodhpur DCP appeals for peace
259.article_body: Vandita Rana, DCP of Jodhpur West, said police officials have been deployed near Jalori Gate and in front of the Eidgah after violence happened in the area on Monday. She said deployment has also been done on various major roads. Further, she said an appeal for peace has been made and that both groups have been cooperating with the police.

260.title: Error by a Citi trader briefly wipes out $315 billion from stocks in Europe
260.article_body: The sudden plunge in European shares which was driven by a brief crash in Nordic markets was caused by a single sell order trade by Citigroup, Reuters reported. Citigroup said one of their traders in London made an error while inputting a transaction. The sudden plunge in the market briefly wiped out $315 billion from European stocks.

261.title: Anil Kapoor has been a support system; we had an easy relationship: Fatima
261.article_body: Speaking about working with actor Anil Kapoor in 'Thar', his co-star, Fatima Sana Shaikh, said he has been like a support system to her in the Hindi film industry. She added that Anil would always encourage her whenever her morale was down. "We had a very easy relationship on...sets, it was...warm. I want to work with him again," Fatima said.

262.title: Rakul, Bhumi in talks for Arjun Kapoor's 'Meri Patni Ka Remake': Report
262.article_body: The makers of 'Meri Patni Ka Remake' are reportedly in advanced talks with Rakul Preet Singh and Bhumi Pednekar for the upcoming Arjun Kapoor-starrer film. As per report, the film will be directed by Mudassar Aziz, the filmmaker behind films like 'Pati Patni Aur Woh' and 'Happy Bhag Jayegi'. It'll reportedly go on floors in the second half of 2022.

263.title: Unidentified person impersonates Punjab & H’yana HC Chief Justice, booked
263.article_body: An unidentified person has been booked for allegedly impersonating Punjab and Haryana High Court Chief Justice, Ravi Shankar Jha and asking people for Amazon gift cards. According to the complainant, an office executive at Chandigarh Judicial Academy, the accused contacted him via WhatsApp on March 24 and asked him to send some Amazon gift cards.

264.title: You're creating enemies in your house by saying 'You're Tamilian, speak in Hindi': Sonu
264.article_body: Amid the national language debate, singer Sonu Nigam said, "Nowhere in the constitution it's written that Hindi is our national language." "You're creating enemies in your house by saying, 'You are Tamilian, you speak in Hindi'," Sonu added. He further asserted that nobody should be told what language to speak in, adding, "Let’s not divide people further in our country."

265.title: Religious issues being created to hide Centre's failures: Maha Cong chief
265.article_body: Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole on Monday said religious controversies were being created in the country to hide the failures of the central government. The last eight years of BJP-led central government has led to inflation, unemployment and farm distress, Patole added. Further, while reacting to Raj Thackeray's loudspeaker removal demand, Patole said that no one is above the law.

266.title: US politician Laurie Cumbo's boyfriend proposes to her at Met Gala red carpet, pics viral
266.article_body: American politician Laurie Cumbo's boyfriend Bobby Digi Olisa proposed to her at red carpet of Met Gala 2022, which was held at Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York City (NYC). "You wait for this moment your whole life almost and for it to be right here...it was everything I thought it'd be," Cumbo, who's NYC's cultural affairs commissioner, said.

267.title: Irrfan's son Babil to star in Farhan's web series Friday Night Plan: Report
267.article_body: Irrfan Khan's son Babil Khan has reportedly bagged Farhan Akhtar and Ritesh Sidhwani's production venture 'Friday Night Plan'. According to the report, the web series, directed by Vatsal Neelakantan, went on floors over the weekend. Babil will make his acting debut with 'Qala' in which he will share screen space with Triptii Dimri and Swastika Mukherjee.

268.title: Russia has forgotten all the lessons of World War II: Zelenskyy
268.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov's suggestion that "Adolf Hitler had Jewish blood" shows "Russia has forgotten all the lessons of World War II or maybe they never studied those lessons". Zelenskyy, who is Jewish, made these comments in his nightly video address. Israel called Lavrov's comments "unforgivable" and demanded an apology from Moscow.

269.title: Hardik Patel removes 'working president of Gujarat Congress' from his Twitter bio
269.article_body: Congress' Hardik Patel has removed the mention of "working president of Gujarat Congress" from his Twitter bio amid reports that he is unhappy with the party. Patel's Twitter bio now reads "Proud Indian Patriot. Social and Political Activist". Earlier, Gujarat Congress chief Jagdish Thakor had said that Patel is not making himself available to resolve differences when invited for talks.

270.title: Uniform Civil Code is not required in India, says Owaisi
270.article_body: AIMIM leader Asaduddin Owaisi said that the Uniform Civil Code is not required in the country. "As per the Goa civil code, Hindu men have the right of second marriage if wife fails to deliver a male child by the age of 30. BJP has the government in that state too but they are silent over the matter," he stated.

271.title: US couple gets married midair aboard flight to Las Vegas; pics surface
271.article_body: Pam Patterson and Jeremy Salda got married aboard Southwest Airlines flight to Las Vegas after their original flight to the city got cancelled. As they boarded the plane, the pilot noticed they were wearing wedding dress and asked the bride about it. Patterson joked that they should just get married on the flight and the pilot said, "Let's do it!"

272.title: I have been waiting for last five years to get a chance: Rinku Singh
272.article_body: KKR's Rinku Singh, who was named Man of the Match for his unbeaten 42-run innings against RR, said he has been waiting for the last five years to get regular chances in IPL. "I'm the first [from Aligarh] to play in the IPL," he added. Rinku made his IPL debut in 2018 but has played only 13 games so far.

273.title: Right from powerplay, it was just the start we needed: Shreyas on win vs RR
273.article_body: KKR captain Shreyas Iyer said they got just the start they needed after they conceded 38 runs in the powerplay and took a wicket during RR's innings on Monday. Shreyas also praised Sunil Narine, Umesh Yadav and Rinku Singh for their performances in the match as they won by seven wickets. KKR ended their five-match losing streak with the win.

274.title: Gujarat ATS seizes heroin worth ₹775 cr from house in UP's Muzaffarnagar
274.article_body: Gujarat Anti Terrorist Squad (ATS), in a joint operation with Delhi Police and Uttar Pradesh Police, on Monday seized around 155 kilograms of heroin worth ₹775 crore from a house in UP's Muzaffarnagar. Notably, the accused was earlier arrested by the Gujarat ATS after 35 kilograms of heroin was allegedly found from his factory premises in Muzaffarnagar.

275.title: Pune traffic officer gets award for saving 8-year-old girl's life
275.article_body: Pune City Police's Traffic Control branch officer, Naik Sameer, was conferred a bravery award by a social organisation for saving the life of an eight-year-old girl last month. Naik had picked up the girl, who'd been in a traffic accident, and ran to the hospital after realising that the ambulance may arrive late. An auto-rickshaw driver had also helped Naik.

276.title: Both Ram Charan & Jr NTR are electrifying: Anupam after watching RRR
276.article_body: On Monday, actors Anil Kapoor and Anupam Kher went to the theatre to watch 'RRR'. Sharing his review of the film on Twitter, actor Anupam Kher wrote, "Watched SS Rajamouli's #RRR. What an amazingly entertaining movie. High on content, performances, songs, dances and action sequences! Both Ram Charan and Jr NTR are electrifying. Loved the climax."

277.title: Bengaluru reports 103 new COVID-19 cases, zero deaths
277.article_body: Bengaluru on Monday reported 103 new cases of COVID-19 as compared to Sunday, when the city reported 93 new cases. According to Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike, the city reported zero deaths and 73 new recoveries in the last 24 hours. Further, with 1,731 active cases, the positivity rate now stands at 3.89%, the civic body added.

278.title: IMD to launch 'Urban Meteorological Services' in 50 cities by 2023
278.article_body: The IMD will be launching the Urban Meteorological Services for over 50 cities by next year. "Urban meteorology processes are completely different from meteorology processes in countryside areas," an IMD official said. "In cities, there are urban heat islands which can play a contributory factor in regulating weather parameters, like temperature," another IMD official said.

279.title: Delhi airport 2nd busiest in March 2022; ahead of Dubai, London: Report
279.article_body: According to report by Official Airline Guide, Delhi's Indira Gandhi International (IGI) Airport has emerged as world's second busiest in March this year, following Hartsfield-Jackson International Airport in Atlanta in United States, which is at number one. The report said Delhi airport saw 3.61 million seats booked this March. IGI Airport is followed by Dubai and London airports on list.

280.title: Shanghai resident sent to morgue alive; probe on
280.article_body: A resident of a nursing home in Shanghai was reportedly sent to the morgue alive in an apparent mistake which has prompted an investigation by the authorities and angry reactions from the netizens. The person was later sent to a hospital for treatment and was said to be stable. Four people, including the Director of the nursing home, were dismissed.

281.title: 2 teachers allegedly come to school drunk in H'yana; protest held
281.article_body: A government school in a village in Haryana's Jind was shut down as parents and students held a protest accusing two teachers of coming to work in an inebriated state and abusing children. A local said that the school's head had failed to take action against the teachers. The school gate was opened after block education officer reached the spot.

282.title: Woman loses ₹89 lakh as 33-yr-old poses as RAW agent, offers visa help
282.article_body: Bengaluru Police arrested 33-year-old man for cheating a woman of ₹89 lakh after posing as a RAW agent and offering her help with visa. Woman said she met him on flight, where he offered to help her after her application for Italian and Czech Republic visas was rejected. She gave him ₹89 lakh in September 2021 but got no response.

283.title: Man who threw woman off moving train for resisting molestation held in MP
283.article_body: A 26-year-old man, who threw a 25-year-old woman off a moving train for resisting molestation bid near Khajuraho in Madhya Pradesh's Chhatarpur in April, has been arrested. Police got leads from an unattended mobile phone from the spot, which belonged to the accused, an official said. The victim was returning home after visiting Bageshwar Dham temple, police had said earlier.

284.title: Student suicide cases on rise in Rajasthan's Kota, 4 deaths reported in a month
284.article_body: The number of suicide cases among students in Rajasthan's Kota has surged in the past few months as the city reported four such deaths in over 30 days time. On Monday, 18-year-old student Ranveer Singh, who was a resident of Bihar and had come to study in Kota a month ago, committed suicide. He was preparing for medical exams.

285.title: Ex-policeman found guilty of assaulting officer during US Capitol riot
285.article_body: An ex-New York City police officer was on Monday found guilty of assaulting a police officer during January 6, 2021, US Capitol riot. A federal jury in the District of Columbia rejected Thomas Webster's argument that he was acting in self-defence when he struck an officer with a flagpole and tackled him. The 56-year-old will be sentenced on September 2.

286.title: Maharashtra police beat up man for keeping shop open late at night
286.article_body: A man was allegedly beaten up by police officers in Maharashtra's Aurangabad for keeping his shop open late at night. A video of the incident has surfaced online. A police officer said that the man had refused and used abusive language when the officers asked him to shut his shop on noticing that it was open past 12.30 am.

287.title: Actress Blake Lively's Met Gala dress transforms from copper into aqua blue, pics viral
287.article_body: Actress Blake Lively wore a transforming dress at the Met Gala 2022, whose theme was 'In America: An Anthology of Fashion'. Lively wore a red-toned gown featuring a large bow. The actress' bow was untied after a while, unveiling a long blue train. "I arrived copper and then like New York City classic architecture, I patinaed," she said.

288.title: 4 students injured as plaster falls from school lobby roof in Gujarat
288.article_body: Four students of a government primary school in Gujarat's Mahisagar district were injured on Monday after cement plaster from the roof of lobby fell on them. The incident occurred during the farewell function of a retiring teacher. Along with students, their parents, villagers and school management committee members were also present, said District Primary Education Officer (DPEO) PN Modi.

289.title: Child trafficking racket busted in Lucknow, 2-year-old boy rescued
289.article_body: A child trafficking gang was busted by the Government Railway Police (GRP), Charbagh in Lucknow after a two-year-old baby was rescued from the possession of three alleged kidnappers. The three accused were arrested while a minor was detained. "The complainant is homeless and lives on the platform along with his three children, including the two-year-old baby," a police official said.

290.title: Ebola outbreak in DR Congo prompts high alert in Tanzania
290.article_body: Tanzania has been put on high alert following an Ebola outbreak in neighbouring Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC), which has reportedly caused the death of two persons. The Tanzanian government said it has sent teams of surveillance experts to areas bordering DRC. "People should take precautionary measures as the government is working on the issue," said a government official.

291.title: Mom's skin turned dark; she saw herself, broke down: Daughter on Nargis' cancer
291.article_body: Late actress Nargis' daughter Namrata Dutt said that her mother "broke down" after she saw her reflection in mirror after her chemotherapy treatment after being diagnosed with pancreatic cancer. "Her skin had turned dark with chemotherapy. She had lost hair. She couldn't believe what she saw," Dutt said. She added that they talked to Nargis when she was in coma.

292.title: 40% of global real-time digital payments took place in India in 2021: PM
292.article_body: PM Narendra Modi while addressing the Indian community in Germany's Berlin said of all the global real-time digital payments in 2021, 40% took place in India. "Almost 10,000 services of Central government, state government and local self-government have become available online," he added. "The way technology is being included in governance shows...new political will of the new India," PM stated.

293.title: For my son, Nadal is no longer no.1; Alcaraz is his favourite: Djokovic
293.article_body: World number one Novak Djokovic said Spain's Carlos Alcaraz has replaced Rafael Nadal as his son Stefan's favourite player over the last month. "Alcaraz is a big star already. He's got the whole package. I really like him. I have so much respect for him," added Djokovic. "I have had some amazing battles with Nadal. It's always special," stated Djokovic.

294.title: PM Modi extends greetings on Eid-ul-Fitr, calls for brotherhood
294.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi took to Twitter on Monday to extend greetings on the occasion of Eid-ul-Fitr. "Best wishes on Eid-ul-Fitr. May this auspicious occasion enhance the spirit of togetherness and brotherhood in our society," he tweeted. "May everyone be blessed with good health and prosperity," PM Modi added.

295.title: I was hiding inside my house for 2 weeks: Osaka on her media boycott
295.article_body: Discussing her decision to boycott post-match media duties in 2021, ex-world number one Naomi Osaka said, "I was really sad. I was...embarrassed. I was kind of hiding inside my house for like two weeks." "I didn't really know how to cope with it," added Osaka. "Even though I was...scared, I was happy with the choice that I made," stated Osaka.

296.title: BSNL, MTNL likely to switch to 4G by end of 2022: Devusinh Chauhan
296.article_body: The Bharat Sanchar Nigam Limited (BSNL) and Mahanagar Telephone Nigam Limited (MTNL) are likely to switch to 4G network by the end of 2022, MoS for Communications, Devusinh Chauhan, said. Chauhan added that the 5G spectrum will be rolled out by December-end across India. "We are setting up the infrastructure for 5G spectrum, which will soon see auctions," Chauhan stated.

297.title: It split me open: Gwyneth Paltrow on losing her father at 30
297.article_body: Gwyneth Paltrow has revealed that she lost her father, Bruce Paltrow, to throat cancer when she was 30 years old. "When it first happened I never anticipated that it was possible to have a feeling like that. It was not in my lexicon of emotions," she added. "It was so physical it felt like it split me open," Gwyneth said.

298.title: HC stays lower court observations against Assam Police in Mevani case
298.article_body: The Gauhati High Court stayed the observations, which were critical of Assam Police, made by a lower court while granting bail to Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani. Sessions Judge Aparesh Chakravarty had observed that the case against Mevani, filed for allegedly outraging the modesty of a woman police officer, was "manufactured" by police only to extend his custody.

299.title: AAP members arrested after clash with BJP workers in Gujarat
299.article_body: A clash broke out between workers of Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) and BJP in Gujarat's Surat on Monday. Several AAP members, including its state unit chief Gopal Italia, were arrested on charges of rioting. The incident occurred when AAP workers marched to the BJP headquarters to protest against the alleged assault on their councillors at Surat Municipal Corporation.

300.title: Haryana BJP MLA takes oath to make India 'Hindu Rashtra', video surfaces
300.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party MLA Aseem Goel on Sunday took an oath to make India a 'Hindu Rashtra'. A video of incident was shared online. The pledge that was administered by Sudarshan News' Suresh Chavhanke, said, "We pledge to make Hindustan Hindu Rashtra...If needed...we will make or take sacrifice for it but at any cost...we will declare Hindustan as Hindu Rashtra."

301.title: India records 2,568 COVID-19 cases, 20 deaths in the last 24 hours
301.article_body: India has reported 2,568 COVID-19 cases, 2,911 recoveries and 20 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 3,157 COVID-19 cases and 26 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 19,137, while the death toll has risen to 5,23,889.

302.title: Samson takes review in frustration to protest umpire's wide ball call, video goes viral
302.article_body: RR captain Sanju Samson took a review in frustration to protest umpire calling a wide in second-last over of KKR's run chase. KKR's Rinku Singh had shuffled across and failed to make contact with ball, with the umpire signalling it wide. Sanju opted for a review for caught behind. The replays confirmed the ball being far away from the bat.

303.title: We thought it was the last day of our life, I'll never fly again: SpiceJet flyer
303.article_body: A 22-year-old passenger named Imamul Ansari onboard Mumbai-Durgapur SpiceJet aircraft that encountered severe turbulence said, "We thought it was going to be the last day of our life. I'll never board a flight again." He added, "This was my first flight experience, and it landed me in hospital." He suffered a fracture in right-hand finger and injuries in his back.

304.title: BJP leader urges Delhi CM to remove loudspeakers from religious places
304.article_body: BJP leader Adesh Gupta on Monday wrote to Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal urging him to immediately remove loudspeakers from religious and other places as per the Supreme Court’s guidelines. "Wrote a letter to CM Arvind Kejriwal…Due to noise pollution, children, elderly people, patients and people working in offices have to face difficulties every day," Gupta tweeted.

305.title: Map out road routes to speed up coal transport: CM Yogi tells officials
305.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Monday directed officials to map out road routes to speed up coal transport to thermal power plants in the state amid the ongoing power crisis. Calling for a wide-scale reform in the power sector, he asked the officials to bring major changes at all levels and meet the increasing electricity demand.

306.title: Kim wears Marilyn Monroe's dress at Met Gala, says 'Lost 7 kg in 3 weeks to fit into it'
306.article_body: American media personality Kim Kardashian wore the custom-made Jean Louis Gown that was worn by Marilyn Monroe during her performance for ex-US President John F Kennedy in 1962. Kim revealed she lost 7 kg in three weeks to fit into the dress, which holds the Guinness World Record for 'most expensive dress sold at auction' at $4.8 million.

307.title: Tuition teacher told mom 'Your son is only interested in my clothes': Manish
307.article_body: Fashion designer Manish Malhotra in a conversation with Twinkle Khanna revealed that his mother hired a tuition teacher for him when he was five or six years old. "[Mom] knew I was a duffer student," he said, adding, "Tuition teacher told her 'Your son is only interested in my clothes...He never studies and...keeps telling me...my sandals aren't matching my dress'."

308.title: When I came, everybody was against it: Ibrahimović on Man Utd stint
308.article_body: Discussing his experience while representing Manchester United, ex-Barcelona striker Zlatan Ibrahimović said, "When I came, everybody was against it...and...in England they didn't like me." "I like people when they hate you [as]...they bring out the better of you," added Ibrahimović. "All [the] haters after three months, they started [liking]...me. I didn't like them anymore," stated Ibrahimović.

309.title: School bus collides with tractor in Gurugram, bus driver dies
309.article_body: A 40-year-old school bus driver died and over 15 students escaped unhurt after their speeding school bus rammed a stationary tractor on Gurugram's Sohna Road. The bus driver was ferrying students to GD Goenka World School when the incident took place at around 8.15 am. "The younger students were traumatised and wanted to return home," the police said.

310.title: Muslims being targeted with violence around the world: Biden
310.article_body:
Addressing a White House reception to celebrate Eid-ul-Fitr, US President Joe Biden said 
Muslims are being targeted with violence all over the world. "No one should discriminate against oppressed or be oppressed for their religious beliefs," Biden added. He also said that Muslims make America stronger every day "even as they still face real challenges and threats in our society".

311.title: Prabhudeva to choreograph Chiranjeevi & Salman Khan's song in Godfather
311.article_body: Choreographer Prabhudeva will choreograph actors Chiranjeevi and Salman Khan for a special song in 'Godfather'. Music composer of 'Godfather', S Thaman, took to Twitter to share a picture with Chiranjeevi, director Mohan Raja along with Prabhudeva to welcome him on board. He wrote, "Prabhudeva will be choreographing an atom bombing swinging song for our boss Chiranjeevi and Salman...What a high."

312.title: He needed to make a statement, he did it: McCullum on Rinku's 42*(23) vs RR
312.article_body: KKR head coach Brendon McCullum has praised Rinku Singh after their win against RR, stating that the 24-year-old needed to make a statement and he did it with his unbeaten 42-run innings in the match. "Rinku has been in the franchise for a long period of time. Lucky enough to spend some time with him," added McCullum.

313.title: 3-level security system launched at Durgam Cheruvu in Hyderabad
313.article_body: The Cyberabad Police on Monday launched a three-level security system, including surveillance cameras, electric bike patrolling unit and lake patrolling boat, at Durgam Cheruvu in Hyderabad. This comes amid reports of bike races, a suicide and other disturbing activities near Durgam Cheruvu and its surroundings. The new surveillance system has been established in public-private partnership mode.

314.title: Stone pelting in Jodhpur, internet services suspended; CM appeals to maintain peace
314.article_body: Internet services have been suspended in Rajasthan's Jodhpur after a stone-pelting incident and clashes between two communities at Jalori Gate. "All 2G/3G/4G/ Data, bulk SMS/MMS/Whatsapp, Facebook, Twitter...except voice calls, broadband internet, leased lines...suspended till further orders," the order reads. CM Ashok Gehlot appealed to maintain peace and cooperate in maintaining law and order.

315.title: 43-yr-old man dies after speeding autorickshaw hits two-wheeler in Pune
315.article_body: A 43-year-old man died after a two-wheeler that he was driving was hit by a speeding autorickshaw in the Pimpri area of Pimpri-Chinchwad in Pune, police said. The accident took place when the rickshaw driver, coming from the opposite direction, allegedly hit the man, which caused him to fall from his vehicle. The victim had received head injuries, police added.

316.title: French to be introduced in 30 Delhi govt schools
316.article_body: The Delhi Board of Senior Secondary Education (DBSSE) tied up with Institut Français en Inde (IFI) to introduce French in city's government schools. In the pilot phase, French will be introduced in 30 schools and is supposed to expand further to other schools. Introduction of French will unlock new career options for our students, Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said.

317.title: I miss the glamorous life sometimes: Evelyn on a new life in Australia
317.article_body: Actress Evelyn Sharma, who's settled in Australia with her husband and daughter, said she misses Bollywood sometimes. "Glamorous life, I do miss it sometimes. Red carpet and getting dressed up. Beautiful gowns and sarees...But it's all come together so well," she added. "I don't even need to think of what could've been, because it (her present life) is...perfect," Evelyn said.

318.title: Structure collapses on workers in Pune; 1 dead, 4 seriously injured
318.article_body: A 40-year-old worker was killed and four others were seriously injured after a slab structure collapsed on them at an under-construction building site in Pune on Monday. "After the collapse of the slab structure...workers were trapped under the metal and wooden bars," a senior inspector said. A total of 25 workers were on site when the incident took place.

319.title: Ayurvedic doctor, wife perform illegal abortion in Panchkula, booked
319.article_body: An Ayurvedic doctor, Anil Kaushal and his wife have been booked for allegedly carrying out an illegal abortion in Panchkula's Rajiv Colony. The matter came to light when the patient suffered multiple organ failure after being diagnosed with post-abortion infection at government hospital. When asked, her husband revealed she underwent an abortion at a clinic on April 26 and 27.

320.title: 2 yrs after body was found, 2nd wife, lover held for killing Pune man
320.article_body: Nearly two years after his body was found, a man's second wife, Pallavi, and her lover, Ganesh, were arrested for killing him. Ganesh and Pallavi made plan for latter to befriend Ganesh's uncle, Savkar Ghule, and marry him for property. Pallavi convinced Ghule to sell off his property. Later, Pallavi and Ganesh fed Ghule poison and dumped body on roadside.

321.title: Wickets at the wrong time stopped me from going on with momentum: Samson
321.article_body: RR captain Sanju Samson, who top-scored for his team with 54(49) against KKR, said he stopped himself from going on with the momentum as they kept losing wickets at "the wrong time". "Wanted to build up a partnership and when I wanted to go hard...they bowled really well," he added. KKR defeated RR by seven wickets in the match.

322.title: UK to provide $375 mn of further military aid to Ukraine
322.article_body: The UK has said it'd provide an additional £300 million ($375 million) in military aid to Ukraine. The new package includes electronic warfare equipment, a counter-battery radar system, GPS jamming equipment and night vision devices. Britain has sent Ukraine over 5,000 anti-tank missiles, five air defence systems and other munitions and explosives since the Russian invasion began on February 24.

323.title: Cocaine worth ₹80 cr found hidden in trolley bags at Hyd airport
323.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) officers have seized a total of 8 kg of cocaine worth ₹80 crore from two foreign nationals at the Hyderabad International Airport, in separate incidents. The accused carried 4 kg of cocaine each, which was hidden in the false bottoms of their trolley bags. The two accused were apprehended by the DRI officers.

324.title: Mango Mela to be held in Bengaluru after gap of 2 years
324.article_body: The annual Mango Mela will return to Bengaluru this year after a gap of two years owing to COVID-19 pandemic. According to a government official, the mela or festival will be organised in Lalbagh and Cubbon Park around the first or second week of June. "We will also have district-level melas after the second week of May," said the official.

325.title: Now no PM will have to say he sends ₹1, but only 15 paise reaches people: PM Modi
325.article_body: Addressing the Indian community in Berlin, Prime Minister Narendra Modi talked about the success of digital payment mechanism in India. He said that the government is using the mechanism to make payments to farmers directly. PM Modi said that now no Prime Minister will have to lament that he sends one rupee, but only 15 paise reaches the beneficiary.

326.title: Spurious seeds racket busted in Hyderabad, 2 arrested
326.article_body: The Rachakonda Police on Monday busted an inter-state spurious seeds racket in Hyderabad and arrested two persons. Police also seized 15 quintals of spurious cotton BT3 seeds, a car and two mobile phones, all worth ₹30 lakh. According to police, the accused allegedly procured the seeds from Karnataka and sold them to unsuspecting farmers in Telangana, Maharashtra and Odisha.

327.title: 66-yr-old ex-India cricketer Arun Lal marries 28 years younger Bulbul Saha, pics surface
327.article_body: Former India cricketer Arun Lal tied the knot with 38-year-old Bulbul Saha in Kolkata on Monday. It is the 66-year-old Bengal cricket team head coach's second marriage. The wedding was attended by former India wicketkeeper Saba Karim and MP Derek O'Brien. Bulbul Saha is a teacher by profession.

328.title: List of Indian cities with highest maximum temperature on Monday released
328.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) released a list of cities recording the highest maximum temperature on Monday. Rajasthan's Ganganagar and Churu recorded the highest maximum temperature at 45.3°C each. Maharashtra's Chandrapur recorded 45.2°C. Maximum temperature of more than 45°C was recorded at three stations on Monday as compared to over 30 stations on April 29.

329.title: Natasha Poonawalla wears metal bustier with Sabyasachi saree at Met Gala, look goes viral
329.article_body: Serum Institute of India's executive director Natasha Poonawalla wore a Schiaparelli hand-forged metal bustier paired with a custom Sabyasachi couture saree and trail at the Met Gala 2022. According to Sabyasachi, Natasha Poonawalla's vision for the event was to interpret the dress code 'gilded glamour' with an Indian gaze that revels in its multi-culturalism and authenticity.

330.title: Wife's friends felt we won't last, said 'film people are over friendly': Shaan
330.article_body: Singer Shaan said before his marriage, his wife Radhika's friends used to say film people are over friendly. "[They said] today they are here, tomorrow they are there," Shaan said, adding, "I was her first boyfriend...six years older to her...so they didn't think that we would last...I also didn't have such hopes because we were very different from each other."

331.title: Amit Shah to inaugurate Nrupathunga University in Bengaluru today
331.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah is scheduled to inaugurate the Nrupathunga University, formerly called Government Science College, in Bengaluru on Tuesday. The college, which was established by the erstwhile Maharaja of Mysore Nalvadi Krishnaraja Wadiyar, had attained university status in 2020. The university offers undergraduate and postgraduate courses, as well as research programmes for students.

332.title: 45-yr-old driver killed after school bus rams into tractor in Gurugram
332.article_body: A 45-year-old bus driver was killed as the school bus that he was driving rammed into a tractor-trolley on Gurugram's Sohna Road. As many as 15 school students and school staff were also on the bus and they were unhurt, police said. "It is not clear if the tractor suddenly stopped or it had been parked," police added.

333.title: Mumbai man uses fake number plates to escape ₹24,300 e-challan dues
333.article_body: Mumbai Police have arrested a man for using fake number plates on his bike in a bid to avoid payment of e-challan dues worth ₹24,300. An FIR was filed against the man on April 30, for cheating the government, following which, he was arrested. During investigation, police found that two number plates had been registered under the man's name.

334.title: KKR end their 5-match losing streak, hand RR their 2nd straight defeat
334.article_body: KKR defeated RR by seven wickets on Monday to end their five-match losing streak and move to the seventh position on the IPL 2022 points table. Rinku Singh and Nitish Rana's unbeaten 66-run partnership helped KKR chase down the 153-run target in 19.1 overs. RR have now lost two matches in a row.

335.title: When the world faces a problem, India brings solutions: PM Modi in Berlin
335.article_body: PM Modi while addressing the Indian diaspora in Germany's Berlin said, "The biggest truth of this third decade of the 21st century is that India is going global." He added, "During COVID-19, India helped save many lives by sending essential medicines to more than 150 countries." When the world faces a problem, India brings solutions, he said.

336.title: New India takes risks, it innovates: PM to Indian community in Germany
336.article_body: PM Narendra Modi while addressing Indian community in Berlin said new India doesn't think of a secure future alone. "It takes risks, it innovates, it incubates," he added. He said, "I remember that around 2014, our country had only 200-400 startups. Today, the country has more than 68,000 startups," PM Modi further said.

337.title: US can't confirm top Russian General injured in Ukraine: Official
337.article_body: The US cannot confirm media reports that the head of the Russian armed forces, General Valery Gerasimov, was injured during a visit to Ukraine's Donbas region, a US official said on Monday. Several media reports have claimed that Gerasimov was wounded during fighting. Notably, Russian forces launched a fresh offensive in Ukraine last month after retreating from the country's north.

338.title: Should we retire then, jokes Shaheen as wicketkeeper Rizwan bowls in county match
338.article_body: Reacting to Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Muhammad Rizwan bowling in a county match, Pakistan fast bowler Shaheen Afridi jokingly tweeted, "Rizzi bhai, should we retire then?" Shaheen added, "What are you doing? Leave something for us." Rizwan, who represents Sussex in county cricket, bowled two overs against Durham, conceding five runs.

339.title: People of India made government stronger in 2019: PM Modi in Berlin
339.article_body: PM Narendra Modi while addressing Indian community in Berlin said a full majority government was elected in India in 2014 after 30 years and the people of the country made the government stronger in 2019. "The people of India ended the politically unstable atmosphere of the last three decades by pressing a button," PM Modi added.

340.title: Google makes $100,000-online courses free to every US business
340.article_body: Google announced on Monday that it will provide any US business over $100,000 worth of online courses in data analytics, design and other tech skills for their workers free of charge. The offer marks an expansion of Google's Career Certificates, which was launched in 2018. As per Google, 205,000 people globally have earned at least one certificate through the program.

341.title: Delhivery IPO likely to open on May 11, firm to raise ₹5,235 cr: Report
341.article_body: The initial public offering (IPO) of logistics startup Delhivery is likely to open for subscription on May 11 and close on May 13, Moneycontrol reported citing senior bankers. The Gurugram-based startup now plans to raise ₹5,235 crore through the IPO, down from the ₹7,460 crore planned earlier, Moneycontrol added. The offer will reportedly comprise a fresh issue of ₹4,000 crore.

342.title: Liverpool midfielder Thiago would start for each team in the world: Klopp
342.article_body: Praising Liverpool midfielder Thiago Alcantara, manager Jürgen Klopp said due to his current form he would play in "each team in the world" and for his country Spain as well. Thiago was 'Man of the Match' in Liverpool's 2-0 win over Villarreal in first leg of their semi-final in Champions League. The 31-year-old was bought by Liverpool in September 2020.

343.title: Rare tree kangaroo born in US zoo after 14 years, video released
343.article_body: A zoo in the US has announced the birth of a tree kangaroo for the first time since 2008. The Matschie's tree kangaroo is native to Papua New Guinea and there are fewer than 2,500 of the species remaining in the wild. A video of the newborn has shown it poking its nose out of its mother's pouch.

344.title: Not everyone in KKR dressing room is on the same page: Dasgupta
344.article_body: Speaking about KKR's performance following their five straight losses in IPL 2022 so far, Deep Dasgupta said not everyone in the franchise's dressing room is on the "same page". He added that after KKR won three out of four matches at the start, they should've held to that combination but they made too many changes in the last few matches.

345.title: New Zealand welcomes tourists after 2-year pause due to pandemic
345.article_body: New Zealand on Monday welcomed tourists from across the world for the first time in over two years after dropping most of its remaining pandemic border restrictions. Notably, the borders were opened to tourists from only about 60 countries, including much of Europe. Before the COVID-19  pandemic, New Zealand would welcome around 30 lakh tourists annually.

346.title: CCPA calls meeting with Ola, Uber over several user complaints
346.article_body: The Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) has called a meeting of ride-hailing platforms like Ola and Uber following a "very high" number of complaints from customers. "The complaints [are] regarding the cancellation and pricing policy of cab aggregators," said CCPA Chief Commissioner Nidhi Khare. She added that it appears that cab aggregators are using algorithms to lure new customers.

347.title: Brian Lara only cricketer to score 500 runs in an innings
347.article_body: Ex-West Indies captain Brian Lara scored 501*(427) in a county match in 1994, becoming the first and the only player to score 500-plus runs in an innings in professional cricket. Lara hit 62 fours and 10 sixes during his innings, while representing Warwickshire against Durham. Lara, who turned 53 on Monday, also holds record for the highest Test score (400*).

348.title: People chant '2024, Modi Once More' as PM addresses Indian community in Berlin
348.article_body: A video has shown people chanting '2024, Modi Once More' ahead of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's address to the Indian community in Germany's Berlin on Monday. "Today...I want to talk...about the capabilities of crores of Indians," said PM Modi. He is on the first leg of his visit to three European nations and met German Chancellor Olaf Scholz today.

349.title: 5 of family die as shipping container falls off truck and crushes their car in Gujarat
349.article_body: Five members of a family died as their car met with an accident on the outskirts of Gujarat's Navsari, officials said.
