The victims were returning home from Surat after completing shopping for marriage when their car got crushed under a shipping container. The shipping container fell off a truck and crushed their car, PTI reported.

350.title: Anil Kapoor watches 'RRR' with Anupam Kher, says 'Feels like a date'
350.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher shared a video with Anil Kapoor while they had gone to watch Ram Charan and Jr NTR-starrer 'RRR' in the theatre. In the video, Anil could be heard saying, "I'm feeling as if I am in St Xavier's college...as if I've come out for a date." To this, Anupam responded, "I would not like to say that."

351.title: Sri Lankan govt's focus should be to get aid, not attain parl majority: Ex-PM
351.article_body: Ex-Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe has said that country's political leadership should focus on securing financial aid rather than worrying about attaining a parliamentary majority amid the economic crisis. "National economy has almost collapsed...Problems can't be solved by mustering 113 seats in parliament," he added. Sri Lankan coalition government lost majority after 42 MPs quit alliance.

352.title: RR skipper Samson needs to cut down on risky shots: Jaffer
352.article_body: Talking about Sanju Samson's form in IPL 2022, Wasim Jaffer said RR skipper needs to be calculative and cut down on risky shots since he's batting at number three. "Sometimes playing high-risk cricket can get you in trouble and he isn't someone who is batting at number five or six, where he needs to take that risk," he added.

353.title: When I grew up, Nadal became my great reference: World no. 1 Swiatek
353.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek said growing up she looked up to her elder Agata for playing tennis before Rafael Nadal became her great reference. "I admire his work ethic and how success hasn't changed him, he's still a very nice...humble guy," she added. Having won four consecutive titles in 2022, Swiatek is on a 23-match unbeaten streak.

354.title: I think I am going to be a yes mom: Sonam Kapoor to Anushka Sharma
354.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor, who is expecting her first child with husband Anand Ahuja, responded to Anushka Sharma's Instagram Stories and said that she will be a "YES Mom" for her child. Earlier, Anushka, taking to her Instagram Stories, asked, "How many times in a day do parents end up saying NO...Are you a yes parent or no parent?"

355.title: Alia shares note she received from Big B for 'Gangubai...' performance
355.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt shared several of her selfies on Instagram on Monday. Among them, she shared a picture with a note she received from Amitabh Bachchan for her performance in 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'. "Alia, you are beyond magnificent in 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'," the note from Amitabh read. The veteran actor added that he is "short of words" to praise her performance.

356.title: Over 3,000 civilians killed due to Russia's invasion of Ukraine: UN
356.article_body: The UN human rights office on Monday said that the death toll of civilians killed in Ukraine since the start of the Russian invasion rose to 3,153. Citing access difficulties and ongoing corroboration efforts, it claimed that the real toll is likely considerably higher. Most of the victims were killed by explosive weapons with a wide impact area, it added.

357.title: Rajiv Ranjan replaces Mridul Saggar as MPC ex-officio member
357.article_body: The Board of Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Monday approved the nomination of Executive Director Rajiv Ranjan as an ex-officio member of the monetary policy committee (MPC). Ranjan will replace Mridul Saggar, who is reportedly to retire by end of April. As per his LinkedIn profile, Ranjan was recently the head of the Department of Economic and Policy Research.

358.title: Du Plessis would be a bit jealous, jokes Gaikwad after record partnership with Conway
358.article_body: After registering the highest-ever partnership for CSK with Devon Conway, Ruturaj Gaikwad joked that his former CSK opening partner Faf Du Plessis would be a bit jealous. "It feels really nice to have this record. We didn't expect it. All we wanted was to start off really well [against SRH]," he added. Gaikwad and Conway shared a 182-run opening stand.

359.title: Maha Minister Nawab Malik hospitalised, condition serious: Lawyer
359.article_body: Maharashtra Minister Nawab Malik, arrested by the Enforcement Directorate in a money laundering case, was admitted to a Mumbai hospital as he was suffering from diarrhoea, vomiting, and fever for the last three days, his lawyer informed a court. The lawyer said the minister's condition was serious. The hospital said the minister is under observation at the Intensive Care Unit.

360.title: Practo elevates top executive Siddhartha Nihalani as Co-founder
360.article_body: Bengaluru-based healthcare company Practo on Monday announced the elevation of its long-term executive and growth head Siddhartha Nihalani to the position of Co-founder. With this, Nihalani will accompany other Co-founders, Shashank ND and Abhinav Lal, who were his batchmates at NIT Karnataka. Last year, ahead of its IPO, Zomato had elevated its ex-CFO Akriti Chopra to the Co-founder position.

361.title: 65-yr-old man strangled by 3 sons in Punjab over property dispute
361.article_body: A 65-year-old man was allegedly strangled to death by his three sons over a property dispute in Punjab's Fazilka on Monday. The accused used to often fight with the victim, Chinder Pal, who had disowned the trio, the victim's brother Jaswinder Singh said. The victim's body has been sent for postmortem and the accused are yet to be arrested.

362.title: MP man marries 3 partners at same time as per tribal customs
362.article_body: A 42-year-old man married his three live-in partners at the same function in accordance with tribal customs in Madhya Pradesh's Alirajpur district. Maurya informed PTI that he had got engaged to his first partner in 2003 and his two other partners have also been living with him over the past 15 years. His six children also participated in the rituals.

363.title: Pak may quash ex-PM Nawaz Sharif's conviction in graft cases: Report
363.article_body: Pakistani government may quash or suspend ex-PM Nawaz Sharif's conviction in graft cases to offer him chance to plead afresh before a court, Dawn reported. Minister Rana Sanaullah Khan said federal and Punjab's provincial governments can suspend accused's punishment who's been 'wrongly' sentenced. Sharif, convicted in two corruption cases in 2018, left for London in 2019 for medical treatment.

364.title: Japan, Thailand sign defence deal during PM Kishida's visit
364.article_body: During a visit to Thailand, Japanese PM Fumio Kishida and his Thai counterpart Prayut Chan-o-cha signed a defence agreement on Monday. The agreement would facilitate the transfer of defence hardware and technology from Japan to Thailand, according to Reuters. The deal was signed as Kishida wrapped up the last leg of a three-nation tour of Southeast Asia.

365.title: Denmark to destroy 11 lakh soon-to-expire doses of COVID vaccines
365.article_body: Denmark will destroy 11 lakh doses of COVID-19 vaccines because their expiration date is near, a government agency said on Monday. Denmark has a surplus of vaccines and efforts to donate them to developing countries have failed, it added. The epidemic in Denmark "is currently under control, and the vaccine coverage in the Danish population is high", it further said.

366.title: SBI gives no-dues certificate to farmer withheld over 31 paise
366.article_body: SBI on Monday told the Gujarat High Court that it has issued a no-dues certificate to a farmer after the court said not issuing the certificate over pending dues of 31 paise is "nothing but harassment". SBI added that it couldn't issue it earlier in view of a letter sent by the farmer asking it not to do so.

367.title: Power Grid to buy IL&FS Energy Development Company's CPTCL stake
367.article_body: State-owned Power Grid Corporation of India will purchase IL&FS Energy Development Company Ltd's (IEDCL) equity shareholding in Cross Border Power Transmission Company Ltd (CPTCL), as per a regulatory filing. Currently, Power Grid owns 26% stake in CPTCL while 38% shareholding is with IEDCL. Meanwhile, Satluj Jal Vidyut Nigam (SJVN) owns 26% and Nepal Electricity Authority owns 10% stake.

368.title: Claims of normalcy in J&K self-serving lies, contradictions: Mufti
368.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Mehbooba Mufti on Monday said that claims of normalcy in the Union Territory by the Centre are "self-serving lies and contradictions"."Eid prayers are disallowed yet again in Jama Masjid tomorrow. Stripping people not only of their fundamental rights but also religious freedom symbolises their ruthlessness," she tweeted.

369.title: LIC IPO anchor book oversubscribed; gets bids of over ₹7,000 cr
369.article_body: The anchor investor portion of LIC initial public offering (IPO) was oversubscribed on Monday, the first day of subscription. Reports said the portion received bids in excess of ₹7,000 crore against the offer of ₹5,630 crore for anchor investors out of a total offer size of ₹21,000 crore. Investors likely to have bid include Norges Bank and GIC among others.

370.title: 18-yr-old Harshada wins India's 1st ever gold at junior world weightlifting championships
370.article_body: Harshada Sharad Garud has become the first-ever Indian to win a gold medal at the junior world weightlifting championships. Competing in 45kg category, the 18-year-old lifted a total of 153kg, including 70kg in snatch and 83kg in clean and jerk. Turkey's Bektas Cansu bagged the silver medal, while Moldova's Teodora-Luminita Hincu won the bronze medal in the event.

371.title: 'Paper-thin' loudspeaker that turns any surface into audio source made by MIT
371.article_body: Researchers at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) have developed a "paper-thin" loudspeaker that can turn any surface into an active audio source. The loudspeaker weighs about as much as a dime and produces sound with minimal distortion. As per the researchers, the loudspeaker could be used like wallpaper to cover walls, cars, or aircraft interiors or for immersive entertainment.

372.title: Trump asked 'Can't you just shoot them?' amid protests: Ex-US official in book
372.article_body: Amid widespread 'Black Lives Matter' protests in Washington, former US President Donald Trump had asked, "Can't you just shoot them?", former Secretary of Defense Mark Esper has claimed. "Just shoot them in the legs or something?" Trump had reportedly asked, as per Esper who has revealed details about the time in his memoir.

373.title: Cong's Punjab in-charge recommends disciplinary action against Sidhu
373.article_body: All India Congress Committee (AICC) in-charge of Punjab Harish Chaudhary, in a written letter to Congress President Sonia Gandhi, sought disciplinary action against former Punjab Congress chief Navjot Singh Sidhu. In his letter, Chaudhary wrote Sidhu continued to criticise Congress, even as the party was contesting elections, adding that Sidhu had a "hand in glove with Shrimoni Akali Dal."

374.title: Check loudspeaker usage at religious places: BJP MP to Delhi LG
374.article_body: BJP MP from West Delhi Parvesh Sahib Singh on Monday requested Delhi Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal, Delhi Police and MCDs to ensure loudspeakers installed at religious places are either removed, or used at permissible levels. The Uttar Pradesh government has followed the Supreme Court order appropriately, Verma said, adding, "The same needs to be done by other states as well."

375.title: 3-storey building in Nigeria's Lagos collapses, 8 dead
375.article_body: At least eight people were killed after a three-storey residential building collapsed in Nigeria's Lagos on Sunday, an emergency management official said on Monday. "Twenty-three people have been rescued alive including seven children and 16 adults," the official added. Rescue operations are ongoing to look for more people who might still be trapped under the rubble, the official further said.

376.title: 19-yr-old Priya beats Olympian Dutee in 200m at Khelo India University Games
376.article_body: Priya Mohan, representing Jain University, defeated Olympian and two-time Asian Games silver medallist Dutee Chand to win a gold medal in the women's 200 metres event at Khelo India University Games 2021 in Bengaluru on Monday. The 19-year-old clocked 23.90 seconds, while Dutee finished the race in 24.02 seconds. Earlier on Sunday, Priya won a gold in 400 metres.

377.title: Govt warns Google Chrome users of high-level threat, asks users to update browser
377.article_body: The government's Indian Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT-In) highlighted multiple vulnerabilities in Google Chrome for Desktop in a 'high-severity' warning. Google Chrome's version prior to 101.0.4951.41 is affected. Vulnerabilities allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code, obtain sensitive information and bypass security restrictions. CERT-In requested users to update the browser.

378.title: Director Parthiban throws mic at audience, AR Rahman's reaction viral
378.article_body: A video of music composer AR Rahman's reaction to director Parthiban throwing a mic at the audience during a song launch event for 'Iravin Nizhal' has gone viral on social media. Parthiban lost his cool and threw the mic at the audience after Robo Shankar asked him to pass the mic. He later apologised and cited pressure as the reason.

379.title: Fabindia gets SEBI's approval for raising funds through IPO
379.article_body: Lifestyle retail brand Fabindia has received market regulator SEBI's approval to raise funds through its IPO. According to Fabindia's draft red herring prospectus, its IPO includes fresh issue of shares worth upto ₹500 crore and an offer for sale of over 2.5 crore shares. The firm's promoters also plan to gift over seven lakh shares to artisans and farmers.

380.title: Eid is even more special with success of 'KGF 2': Sanjay Dutt's wife
380.article_body: Sanjay Dutt's wife Maanayata said this year's Eid will be more special for them because of the success of 'KGF: Chapter 2'. "All the love and support Sanjay received for his performance in the film," she stated. "Despite all the challenges...he powered through for the love of his fans...the success of the film reinstilled that love even more," she added.

381.title: Hope to shift our embassy back to Kyiv by May-end: US amid invasion
381.article_body: US expects to shift its embassy back to Kyiv by May-end if conditions are feasible, its charge d'affaires said on Monday. US diplomats had departed from Kyiv embassy weeks before the Russian invasion of Ukraine began and had relocated some of its functions to Lviv, before shifting to Poland. Countries including UK and Hungary have reopened their embassies in Kyiv.

382.title: Hopeful to play vs Nadal on my 19th birthday at 2022 Madrid Open: Alcaraz
382.article_body: Talking about his potential match against Rafael Nadal on his 19th birthday at 2022 Madrid Open, world number nine Carlos Alcaraz said he's hopeful to play on Thursday provided he wins on Tuesday. "It's a special day...hopefully I'll be able to win this year," he added. Alcaraz had lost to the fellow Spaniard on his birthday in Madrid last year.

383.title: Would love to come to India to meet 1st Indian superhero: Benedict
383.article_body: 'Doctor Strange' actor Benedict Cumberbatch has said he would like to come back to India and meet the first Indian superhero. "I love India, I love your...cultures," he stated. Benedict had spent six months in India's Darjeeling to teach English at a Tibetan monastery. "I'd love...to come back...if that's to interact with the first Indian superhero," the British actor stated.

384.title: Choksi pledged fake gemstones to secure ₹25 cr loan from govt-run IFCI: CBI
384.article_body: Fugitive diamantaire Mehul Choksi used "low-quality, lab-prepared chemical vapour diamonds" and other 'fake gemstones' to secure a ₹25 crore corporate loan from government-run IFCI, CBI has alleged. After his company, Gitanjali Gems, defaulted on the loan, it was found that their actual valuation was 98% less than shown by the company. He's accused of cheating IFCI of ₹22 crore.

385.title: It can happen: Sehwag on CSK qualifying for IPL 2022 playoffs under Dhoni
385.article_body: Virender Sehwag has said CSK can reach the playoffs in IPL 2022 under MS Dhoni following his reappointment as skipper. CSK beat SRH by 13 runs to register their first win under Dhoni's captaincy on Sunday. Overall, it was their third win from nine matches. He added that Dhoni-led India have won many matches which they used to lose before.

386.title: Ukraine may lose millions of tonnes of grain due to blockade: Prez
386.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Monday said that Ukraine could lose tens of millions of tonnes of grain due to Russia's blockade of its Black Sea ports. "Russia wants to completely block our country's economy," he added. This could trigger a food crisis that will affect Europe, Asia and Africa, Zelenskyy claimed.

387.title: Political crisis in Maha, won't give them an inch of land: K'taka CM
387.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai on Monday urged politicians of Maharashtra not to use border issues for their political survival, adding that the state will not give an inch of its land. "The politicians of Maharashtra raise the border and language issue whenever they face a political crisis in their state," he said.

388.title: India believes no one will win Russia-Ukraine war: PM Modi in Germany
388.article_body: India believes that no one will be victorious in the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war, PM Narendra Modi said in Germany on Monday. Peace talks are the only way to resolve the Ukraine crisis, he added. "Recent geopolitical incidents have shown that world peace and stability are in critical condition and showed how all countries are interconnected," said PM Modi.

389.title: Germany pledges €10 billion for bilateral cooperation with India
389.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Monday said Germany is pledging €10 billion (approximately ₹80,615 crore) for bilateral cooperation with India in the coming years. "When implementing the measures for these partnership projects, we will provide a great deal of funding over the next few years," Scholz said. This comes after PM Narendra Modi held talks with Scholz in Berlin today.

390.title: Taj Mahal entry to remain free for 2 hours for offering namaz on Eid
390.article_body: Entry to the Taj Mahal will remain free for two hours on the occasion of Eid-ul-Fitr for offering namaz at the mosque on its premises from 7 am to 9 am on Tuesday. Taj Mahal gates had remained closed for namaz on Eid in 2020 and 2021, because of restrictions and curbs imposed during the COVID-19 pandemic.

391.title: AAP expels leader for pro-Khalistan tweets, says it backs India's unity
391.article_body: AAP has expelled its Himachal Pradesh unit leader Harpreet Singh Bedi over his alleged pro-Khalistan tweets. The move came after BJP accused Bedi of supporting Khalistan cause, citing his past tweets which allegedly included demand for new currency for Khalistan. "AAP...believes in...unity & integrity of [India]...& [won't] tolerate anyone writing anything against our country," the party tweeted.

392.title: PIL seeks regulation of polygamy by Muslim men; HC asks Centre's view
392.article_body: Delhi HC on Monday asked the Centre to submit its stand on a Muslim woman's PIL seeking regulation of polygamy practiced by Muslim men. The PIL sought polygamy without the present wife's written consent be declared unconstitutional and illegal. It also sought adequate arrangements for the existing wife's accommodation and maintenance be made before allowing a man to practice polygamy.

393.title: Restaurant staff attack customers after complaint over food taste in Noida
393.article_body: Two people were hospitalised after being allegedly attacked by the staff of a restaurant in UP's Noida after they complained about the taste of cold coffee and shake that they ordered. The complainant Shailendra Pal said the restaurant's owner abused him and his two friends after their complaint. He allegedly called his staff who attacked Shailendra's friends with a knife.

394.title: Germany ready to back EU ban on Russian oil imports: Minister
394.article_body: Germany's ready to support a gradual EU-wide ban on Russian oil imports, Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock has said. Baerbock's comment came after fellow minister Robert Habeck said that the country could be completely independent of Russian crude oil supply by end of summer. Notably, Germany has been top buyer of Russian energy since Ukraine's invasion began, a study recently claimed.

395.title: U'khand limits number of pilgrims for Char Dham Yatra starting May 3
395.article_body: The Uttarakhand government has capped the number of pilgrims during the Char Dham Yatra starting May 3 (Tuesday). Only 15,000 pilgrims will be allowed to visit the Badrinath Temple per day and the daily limit for the Kedarnath Temple is 12,000. It is 7,000 for Gangotri and 4,000 for Yamunotri shrine.

396.title: SpiceJet flight turbulence matter being dealt with deftness: Scindia
396.article_body: Union Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia on Monday said the turbulence encountered by SpiceJet's Mumbai-Durgapur flight is being dealt with "utmost seriousness and deftness". He said that the damage caused to the passengers is "unfortunate", adding that the Directorate General of Civil Aviation has deputed a team to investigate the incident.

397.title: New Zealand-founded IT company offers unlimited leave to employees
397.article_body: New Zealand-founded IT company Actionstep is offering its employees unlimited annual leave, The New Zealand Herald reported. "This way, it covers everything like sick leave, bereavement and maternity," Actionstep's VP of engineering, Stevie Mayhew, said. "We're a team, we trust each other and we believe our best work happens when life & work is in good balance," the company said.

398.title: India hits a century in style: Goyal as Open becomes India's 100th unicorn
398.article_body: Union Minister of Commerce & Industry Piyush Goyal tweeted, "India hits a century in style," after Bengaluru-based neo-banking platform Open became India's 100th unicorn. Open raised $50 million at a valuation of $1 billion in a Series D funding round led by IIFL, Moneycontrol reported. Six months ago, Open raised $100 million led by Google, Temasek, Visa, and SoftBank Investments.

399.title: Training, arming doesn't make Germany party to war in Ukraine: Govt
399.article_body: Germany will not become a party to the Russia-Ukraine conflict because it provides training to Ukrainian soldiers, German government spokesperson Steffen Hebestreit said. The possibility of Ukraine striking Russian territory with weapons it had received from NATO countries would not change this, he added. Last month, Germany had approved the delivery of anti-aircraft tanks to Ukraine.

400.title: Hopeful of things progressing in right direction at Madrid Open: Djokovic
400.article_body: Top seed Novak Djokovic said he's hopeful that things will progress in the right direction at Madrid Open 2022 after his runner-up finish at Serbia Open a few days ago. The world number one added that he has to be positive about his recent result. He further said he's yet to achieve his desired level of play.

401.title: Critic gave bad review to Sarfarosh due to issues with Aamir: Director
401.article_body: 'Sarfarosh' director John Matthew Matthan revealed that a critic gave a negative review to his film after watching it for just the first half because he had issues with Aamir Khan. "He was a total dictator. He saw only half of Sarfarosh. He walked out as he had issues with Aamir since [he] wouldn't attend his award functions," he added.

402.title: Shami told LSG pacer Mohsin that he's better than him: Coach Siddiqui
402.article_body: Revealing what Mohammad Shami told Mohsin Khan some time ago, the LSG pacer's coach Badruddin Siddiqui said, "Shami told him that Mohsin is a better bowler than him but just needed more focus." He added, "I called him during lockdown and said, 'learn whatever you can from Shami'." Playing in his debut IPL, Mohsin has taken eight wickets so far.
